Reviews.Title: “Excellent!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Harout F
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just came back from short 3 day Istanbul vacation. I booked our room at Millennium Suites online after reading many good reviews from previous visitors to the Hotel. I can honestly tell you that our stay at Millennium Suites was very pleasant. We arrived at the airport and our driver was waiting for us as promised by the Hotel staff. Once at the Hotel, the Manager and the staff were very welcoming and went out of their way to make us feel relaxed and comfortable after our trip. The rooms were very clean, spacious and the beds very comfortable. The Hotel is located just a walking distance from the center of town. I travel a lot and finding comfortable beds and clean rooms is very common but what makes Millennium Suites even more special is the help and kind attitude you will receive from the Manager and Staff. I will no doubt stay at Millennium Suites on my next visit to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Unforgettable experience”
Reviews.Author: eduard_manolescu
Reviews.Content: My trip to Istanbul just finished. I booked a room at Millennium Suites and it was the best decision i ever make. After four days spent there i can say that this hotel deserve more than 5+ Star. Everything was just perfect, staff very professional and exceptionally gracious ready to help you to book daily trips or nights at restaurant,room it was very spacious,very clean and luxurious decorated and the entire old area very well preserved and with nice people. Don't forget to ask for a Bus and Boat trip, a night at Oriental House and a good and traditional dinner at Turquoise restaurant. I finish my review saying that this vacation to Istanbul was Perfect, Unforgettable and for sure need to be repeated. Of course at the Same Hotel--MILLENNIUM SUITES

Reviews.Title: “"Great Place to Stay"”
Reviews.Author: Cpilot
Reviews.Content: Millenium Suites is definitely the place to stay in Istanbul. Great location, walking distance to all the main attractions. The owners and all of their staff were wonderful and could not do enough for us. The room was beautiful, clean and finished to a high standard. We will definitely be back and recommend it to all our friends. A perfect last night at the end of a magical vacation. Thank you.

Reviews.Title: “Odenmemis! Herrorragend! Uitstekend! Outstanding!”
Reviews.Author: chuijgens
Reviews.Content: Millenium Suites gets a 5+ Star rating from us for excellence in customer service, high standards of cleanliness, luxuriously decorated and well maintained rooms and lobby, well trained and exceptionally gracious staff AND the best coffee terrace in Sultanahmet for relaxing and people watching! I booked on-line through Istanbulhotels.com and was curious to see if the hotel lived up to it's billing. Alber and his staff were very friendly and exceeded our expectations in every area. After three nights stay, we felt sorry to leave! I would happily stay at Millenium Suites on my next visit to Istanbul. Best wishes for much future success to Alber and crew!! C. Huijgens

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Washington, District of Columbia, United States
Reviews.Title: “Amazing, friendly and spectacular”
Reviews.Author: Bruce S
Reviews.Content: I was recently at the Millennium Suites for 8 days and loved it! The place could not have been more perfect. The location is awesome just a few minutes to the Blue Mosque and the Haggia Sophia. However the best part was the staff and workers. I have never stayed at any hotel where the people were more friendly. They are the best. They taught me about language and culture and they even arranged with great ease an excursion to Ephesus for us. They always had a great restaurant suggestion and could help us find our way about the city using the Tramway, Subway, Tunnel and Veniculars! After we had returned late from our trip to Ephesus they even ordered in pizza for us so we could simply have a bottle of wine and relax in the hotel. I give this hotel my highest rating and only wish I could return again very soon!

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon stay”
Reviews.Author: CCCWi
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here in March of 12 for first 2 nights of honeymoon. The room was a nice comfortable size. The small hotel is newer and was real clean. I requested the room with the balcony (there is only one) which they said may not be available when I emailed them but was delighted when they led me to this room for our stay. The view is a bit sacrificed from this room as it is kind of a back alley feel. If you are looking for a better view you may want to ask for a room with a street view. Outside in front is a small quiet street with many nice restaurants to choose from. Metropolis is recommended. The service was excellent and were funny and helpful. It seemed they went out of there way to accommodate us. Welcome drink, wine in our room, recommendations, always running to the door to open it for us and picking us up from airport. The location also is safe being a couple minutes walk to the blue mosque and other major sites and near four seasons hotel. The hotel is recommended for those who have not been to Turkey as they make you feel comfortable in where you are at. One of the best places I have stayed. CCC USA

Reviews.Title: “FABULOUS!!!!”
Reviews.Author: LeslieMarie_12
Reviews.Content: I would recommend Millennium Suites Hotel in Istanbul to everyone. We stayed for 8 days in late March and did not want to leave. Every single one of the staff made us feel more like FAMILY than hotel guests and we had so much fun exchanging culture, language and gags with them. Its location in the heart of the Old City (Sultanahmet) is ideal. The rooms are lovely. Breakfast is a good mixture of Turkish cuisine and American standards like scrambled eggs and cereal. I can't say enough about Millennium Suites. Stay there. You won't be sorry.

Reviews.Title: “best hotel”
Reviews.Author: monicadavydov
Reviews.Content: This is the best hotel i've ever stay.Rooms are very big and comfortable, location is great, staff is very professional and very kind.Thank you very much for a wonderful vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location in Sultanahmet!”
Reviews.Author: 5700Voss
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Millenieum Suites last weekend, and for us it was the perfect choice for our first trip to Istanbul. First of all the service was superb, and the room was very nice and clean. Since we arrived on my birthday, it was nice to find half a bottle of cold wite whine in the room, and a nice refreshment before we start to explore the sights in the neightbourhood. The staff was always helpful and their knowlegde about Istanbul was very useful fo us. There are also many nice restaurants in the same area, and we could really recommend Metropolis restaurant just across the street from this hotel. So if you are planning a romantic weekend in this fantastic city, this hotel would should be your first choice.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home”
Reviews.Author: davec9591
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently spent 5 nights at the Millenium but this is the type of place you could easily spend many weeks. We arrived close to midnight and were picked up by the shuttle at the airport. (one-way incl in hotel price and highly recommended.) Upon arrival at the hotel, we were warmly greeted by Alper, assisted to our room and were surprised to see a welcome gift (wine, fruit basket, and pastries) on the table. Traveling all day, we decided to grab a bite to eat and the recommended restaurant across the street was open and the food was delicious. Note that Akbiyik street has many good restaurants. This small hotel (7 rooms) is newly renovated, and the rooms are large and clean The following morning, we were greeted by Mr Alper (owner) and Azure who presented us a great spread for breakfast of local dishes, pastries, fruit, cheeses etc...and they also offered omeletes as well. (all also included). Both were very accomodating, polite and extremely friendly which I can say is true for the entire staff including Tanner and Soner who we met later upon our return visiting some of the local attractions such as Hagia Sophia, Blue Mosque, Topkapi Palace which are all within a short walking distance from the hotel. This hotel is in a great location which made it very convenient. It is also very close to the Tram which you can take for 2TL to the Grand Bazaar and other areas (if you don't want to walk). Also recommend taking the Bosphorous Boat tour. It was quite cold during our stay but every day when we returned "home" we were offerred a cup of tea/coffee etc... to warm up (also incl). Woman's Day also popped up during our stay where my wife was given a gift and we also received a departing gift. Needless to stay, we had a great experience with this hotel and they definitely get an A+ in service and made our visit to Istanbul a very memorable one. Kudos to the entire staff. Because of you we hope to visit again with our sons and friends.

Reviews.Title: “Overall OK with an amazing staff”
Reviews.Author: galapiass
Reviews.Content: There were a few hiccups at our arrival and in the bedroom however overall the hotel was good. We stayed there in March, hotel was less than half booked. I asked by email for confirmation of our airport pick up which i never got. Then i called (it was in the evening), and the person didn't speak English very well. I then heard him try to call someone to help him and then the line just cut off. I didn't call back and just took a taxi once i got there, only to be told that actually someone from the hotel was waiting for us. In the room, which was ok, there were a few issues. Big stains on the white curtains, a broken leg chair, some mold on the shower, however nothing really bad. The location was amazing. 5 minutes walk to the Blue Mosque, Tramway station and Saint Sofia. Cant be more central if you want to be in the old town for your stay. The staff were amazingly welcoming. Extremely nice and helpful to a point where it almost felt uncomfortable... but this is also what makes the strength of this hotel with the location.

Reviews.Title: “Central, friendly - and lovely extra touches”
Reviews.Author: BequiaWhispers
Reviews.Content: We visted Istanbul for the first time and, spurred on by TA reviews, booked the Millennium Suites. Good choice! We endorse all the positives you've seen in other reviews, but would particularly pick out: - Sizeable room - Everything clean and (broadly) in good condition - Very friendly and helpful staff We had also expected it to be a bit noisy, given its location - but it wasn't. Perhaps we benefited from having a room at the back of the hotel? Finally, we particularly loved the small-but-special touches: the free drink on arrival, the personalised chat about what we might want to do and see (but with no hard sell), and the small gift on departure. Excellent value for money - we would return.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding experience!”
Reviews.Author: ConcordSL
Reviews.Content: What a treat to stay at this warm, welcoming, clean and delightful hotel in a great area in Istanbul. The room was spacious, clean and had great amenities. The location in the Sultanahmet district is fabulous - it is walking distance to some of Istanbul's best sights, and easy access to public transportation. The breakfast was fabulous, with lots of great and tasty choices. However, with all that said, the best aspect of the hotel was the people - exceptionally accommodating, warm, great with advice on things to do and places to see, able to book great experiences for us, made us feel so comfortable and willing to do anything to make our trip great. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel with great welcome”
Reviews.Author: emile57
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed two nights in for his birthday . On arrival we were welcomed with a tea and sweets and a birthday fruit bowl and wine and a lovely vase of flowers . Breakfast was a real treat Arzu cooked us great eggs and her lovely smile was a great start to the day. Alper (the Manager) was so helpful with suggestions for our itineraries etc. We were also wisked from the airport by VIP car. When we left the young man on reception made sure we left with our gift of local soaps pack. Rooms are very clean and extremely comfortable . We will be back soon I hope thank you to all the team for making our stay so special.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent hotel in the Sultanahmet area”
Reviews.Author: jjkeem
Reviews.Content: When I arrived, a welcome drink was provided during check-in. Although there was no elevator in the 4 story hotel, one of the staff moved our luggages during check-in and check-out. The room size was adaquate and the room was very clean. One bad thing for us was that it was too dark to read a book in the room. Breakfast was Turkish style and quite good. In addition to basic food on the buffet table, fried eggs, omelet, coffee, and turkish tea were provided upon request. Alper, the manager of the hotel, was extremely kind and helpful for everything during our whole stay. I would definitely stay in this hotel again.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Short Hills, New Jersey, United States
Reviews.Title: “A wonderful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Patricia N
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely and most conveniently located hotel for a visit to Istanbul.l The rooms are spacious and immaculately clean. We were able to walk to most of the attractions on our list, and the neighborhood was lively, fun, quaint and overflowing with excellent restaurants, shops and charm. The manager and staff at Millennium could not have been nicer and more eager to help with any request. I rate this hotel highly with absolutely no reservations!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: cas569
Reviews.Content: Ideally located, close to all of the main historical sites, this hotel also provided the 5 star service of the likes of the Four Seasons which is only 2mins away. We could walk from the hotel to see everything that was on our list and we could also hop on the convenient tram to everywhere else. Having said that, we spent most evenings on the same street - there are plenty of great bars and restaurants and it really does have that cosy, chilled out Turkish vibe. On top of all of this, the staff went out of their way every day to make sure our stay was perfect. The room was very clean and comfortable. In fact, we would have been happy if we had spent all holiday in our hotel room only venturing out to eat in a nearby cafe!

Reviews.Title: “What a great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: Andrea P
Reviews.Content: What a great place to stay. From the moment we arrived we were made to feel so welcome by the lovely staff. Its a smallish hotel, so they really made the effort to get to know each guest. In particular, they were great with our two year old - he never went short of attention! One of the ladies was even able to babysit for us one evening, and our son loved spending time with her! The rooms are very nice - spacious (plenty of room for a cot) and very clean and the bed was really comfortable. Breakfast was a delicious spread of fresh local specialities that changed every day. The location is great - only a few minutes walk from Hagia Sophia and the Blue Mosque and 10-15 minutes from the Grand Bazzar and the wharf for the ferry cruises. It's close to trams too. But the thing that really made our stay special was the staff at the hotel. They really had that personal touch and went the extra mile to help. They even gave us a present for our son and baby on the way, which amazed us! Thanks for a great stay!

Reviews.Title: “"Outstanding"”
Reviews.Author: kane18
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a four night stay at this fabulous hotel. The manager Alper and the rest of his staff could not have treated us any better. I could go on and on about how beautiful the rooms are, the stunning breakfast, perfect location etc but I can hand on heart say that there is probably no better hotel in Istanbul than the Millenium Suites.... Shay Cullen (UK)

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great staff, clean and modern rooms, good value”
Reviews.Author: cal776
Reviews.Content: The Millennium Suites is an excellent choice for tourist visitors to Istanbul. Located on a side street in Sultanahmet, the ideal location in the city for tourists, the hotel is an easy five to 10 minute walk from the Hagia Sophia and Blue Mosque and only five minutes further on foot to either the Topkapi Palace or Grand Bazaar. The staff is incredibly friendly and helpful. The rooms are modern, immaculate, and well apportioned. Wi-fi is free, with a very strong signal. The hotel provides good bath amenities and a complimentary 1.5L bottle of water. Breakfast, which is included, is tasty and plentiful. There are a number of restaurants in the neighborhood, including Hayat Cafe, which I highly recommend as both inexpensive and delicious. The only slight negative is the street noise for the rooms facing the street. But even that can't detract from an excellent hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Staff and Service, felt like family”
Reviews.Author: Susan W
Reviews.Content: We booked the Millennium Suites based on other trip advisor reviews and we were thrilled with this lovely boutique hotel. The rooms were very comfortable with a king bed and everything was spotlessly clean. The staff were so friendly and helpful - they really went out of their way to make us feel welcome - we feel the best staff we have ever encountered in our travels. A big Thank you to Alper, Arsu, Tanir and the rest of the staff. By the time we left we felt like family. We enjoyed the breakfast buffet, omlettes made to order and a variety of pastries, cheese etc. The location is great, close to Topkapi, Blue Mosque and the Hagia Sofia and there are good restaurants on the same street. Albura was a favourite of ours. We enjoy small hotels and would highly recommend the Millennium Suites.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic staff and location!”
Reviews.Author: Gypsygirl1
Reviews.Content: There are so many good things to say about this hotel. It is close to many sites, not far from the Sultanhmet tram stop and there are many restaurants nearby. My husband and I booked at this small boutique hotel based on Tripadvisor reviews---THANK YOU!!! Alper, Arsu and the rest of team were so helpful and kind; they really showed us the very best of Turkish hospitality. We were met with welcome drinks (brought to our room with a vase of flowers) as well as a lovely hot breakfast each day and then some beautifully wrapped soap as a farewell gift. (Keep in mind we visited in the off season.) Although all of these touches were very thoughtful, it was the warm attitude from the staff that mattered the most: they obviously cared about us and their business and really took ownership. It was very clean and well cared-for. Satellite t.v., free wifi and bottled water each day reflect the attention to details; that matters to me. l've stayed in a lot of hotels in Europe and North America and this one is special.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Udai B
Reviews.Content: Havent wrote a review on trip adviosr before but this hotel made our stay really comfortable that i have to do this. Its located in prime location - very close to top 3 historic places to visit - topkapi, bue mosque and aya-sofia. There are really good restaurants on the same street, very cosy and romantic restaurants. I had this trip in winter so really liked the restaurants around with fireplace and outside seating etc. Apart from its prime location, the service is really great. We once overslept and missed breaktfast time but they still waited for us. Rooms are really nice and very good view of the street. I am always skeptical about hotel reviews but the hospitality at this place exceeds the reviews. Thanks Tanir for ourcomfortable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, excellent location.”
Reviews.Author: Swiss_mountains
Reviews.Content: We choose the Millennium based on other TripAdvisor reviews. We were not disappointed. The rooms are great, the location is minutes away from the Sultanahmet area with lots of attractions and restaurants. But all this would be meaningless if it was not for the great staff at the Millennium. They were always helpful, offered great advice and really did make it feel like you are visiting a friend's home rather than a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A haven in a busy city”
Reviews.Author: RichnIrene
Reviews.Content: Istanbul is a lovely city and this clean and well kept hotel is in a very convenient location for many of the historic sites. We found all the staff at the hotel genuine, helpful, friendly and happy to make our stay in Istanbul a pleasant one. They stand out amidst a city full of traders who appear to be very hospitable but always with an agenda. It definitely feels like a haven at the end of a long day out. Will definitely go back there on our next trip to Istanbul!

Reviews.Title: “FantÃ¡stico Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: comunitatgt40
Reviews.Content: Se trata de un hotel acogedor, en situaciÃ³n privilegiada con un servicio excelente. La atenciÃ³n es muy buena, la limpieza extraordinaria y las habitaciones muy confortables.. Muy recomendable! This is a very nice hotel in prime location with excellent service. The attention is very good and the hotel and rooms very clean and confortable. Highly Recommended! Es handelt sich um ein sehr schÃ¶ntes Hotel in exzelenter Lage und mit ersklassigem Service. Das Personal ist sehr entgegenkommend und nett, die Zimmer gut eingerichtet und extrem sauber. Sehr zu empfehlen!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel with lovely staff”
Reviews.Author: pippy100
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4nights and the location was spot on for sightseeing as it was within walking distance to the Blue Mosque etc and public transport. The rooms were spacious and very clean and the staff were outstanding. Very friendly and nothing was too much trouble, we one day asked them to organise a few outings and while we were out they had sorted it all out and advised us of the times etc when we got back to the hotel, all done with no stress for us. Breakfast had a good choice but do not expect bacon,sausages etc. It had cereals,pastries, omlette or fried egg, cheeses,bread and fruit. It may be a small boutique hotel but it certainly has a big heart. Thank You to all the staff.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best experience in my life”
Reviews.Author: Gino E
Reviews.Content: Hotel very well presented, staff very very friendly, proffesional and helpful; Firts time in Istanbul and the Customer service make a good difference; Definetly I will recommended the hotel to our fellow Australian travellers. Location excellent and close to everything. I will back to use the service of the Millennium suites again. The staff was so proffesional and multilingual, so easy to communicate and to provide advise and recommendations.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Lisa B
Reviews.Content: My husband & I recently stayed at the Millennium an had a wonderful stay. The staff could not have done any more for us. The went out of their way to provide us with a warm and attentive service. Each morning we had perfect omelettes made to order, even on our last morning when we have a very early start. They organised our transfer from & to the airport and provided us with advice on where to visit and have dinner. Would highly recommend this hotel to anyone travelling to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Millennium for the People with Discerning Tastes”
Reviews.Author: etcetara
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed at the Millennium in Istanbul for 1 week. The staff was extremely friendly and very helpful in meeting our every need. They went out of the way to be certain we were taken care of, in food, lodging, tours and travel to and away from Istanbul. They made it very possible for us to have a relaxing vacation and not be concerned with details. I would recommend the Millennium to anyone! It is quiet, clean, well located in area that does not require the use of taxis for the basics of tourist place to visit. They are very child friendly. Best of luck in your Istanbul trip, the country is amazing. Paul and April

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: GregandU
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel in January. The location is great, 5 min walking to Blue Mosque and Hagia Sophia. Service was outstanding, food was very good and everyone at the hotel was very helpful. Many thanks to Alper, great host and his staff for making our stay pleasurable. If we visit the Istanbul again we will stay at this hotel. Very highly recomended.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mohmmedak20
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel we enjoyed our time. The hotel management are very nice and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Millennium Suites...best of the new Millennium!”
Reviews.Author: Kelly I
Reviews.Content: If you are lucky enough to have chosen the Millennium Suites at which to spend your time in Istanbul, you could do no better. Alper Ozturk and his staff make you feel like family and go out of their way to fulfill your needs and meet your expectations. The rooms are beautiful, welcoming and comfortable. The breakfast each morning is extensive, satisfying, authentic and cooked to order no less! The location of Millennium Suites to all the "must see and must do" historical sights could not be any keener. You can walk everywhere within 15 or 20 minutes at most! The Turkish people are so friendly and that is exhibited in Alper and his staff at the Millennium Suites. The Millennium Suites is on a very quaint cobblestone street with other inns and restaurantss and there were even flowers still blooming in January! Just 2 or 3 blocks from the Marmara Sea, I would definately stay there again without hesitation...it was beyond perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful staff, great location.”
Reviews.Author: Marianna Z
Reviews.Content: Millennium Suites is on Akbiyik Street, which is a perfect location for walking to all the stunning sights -- Topkapi Palace, Hagia Sofia, etc. The staff at Millennium Suites sets it off from the other hotels in this area. They couldn't have been nicer, and were very caring about my comfort. I was treated as an honored guest, yet felt part of their family. The room was stylish and clean.

Reviews.Title: “A SPECTACULAR home away from home in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Courtney M
Reviews.Content: I only agreed to go to Istanbul because my husband was key on going somewhere outside the continental U.S. Due to his work schedule, we literally planned our trip two weeks before we left. I found the Millennium Suites via reviews on TripAdvisor and took a chance trusting the reviews. They did not steer us wrong. All the glowing comments we read were dead on. The location is ideal. It truly is right by the Hagia Sophia, Topkapi Palace, the Basilica Cistern -which was one of my favorite sites-- and the Blue Mosque. It's also super convenient to the tramway and all the restaurants that line it. However, Akbiyik Street itself also offers an abundance of excellent restaurants. (I'll list some at the end of this review.) As for the hotel itself, it's both charming and elegant. Actually, I don't think there's enough praise that can be given to Mr. Alper, the manager, Taner and Alper who were at the front desk, Sonar, or Arzu, who takes care of breakfasts and tea time. (And who's homemade pastries in the morning were AMAZING! My husband has missed those treats, let me tell you.) Taner took vacation while we were there so we had the benefit of his friendly knowledge for the first few days. Then Alper, who worked the front desk at night, came in on days for him. I unfortunately don't recall the man's name who took over for Alper at nights, but he was also super helpful and friendly. We had SO many questions, didn't speak a lick of Turkish, but it was okay. They all knew English. (As well as other languages. We heard them speak German and some French too.) The knowledge and courtesy they exhibited was THE best hands down of any I've received in any hotel ever. They connected us with tour agencies, told us places they liked that we might find interesting to see, never steered us wrong with restaurant recommendations, and even lent us umbrellas the one day it rained during our visit. I can't say enough nice things about the staff. The best thing was we had only booked 3 days to start with because we weren't sure what all we were going to do in Turkey. We ended up liking this hotel so much we asked if they had availability for the rest of our stay and they accommodated us. As for the rooms, the decor was elegant and was cleaned meticulously every day. (As is the case with most hotels, I realize, but they seemed to take extra care.) I felt like a princess staying there! The only thing some people might not like is no elevator. I quickly got used to it and enjoyed the extra exercise. If you're looking for good food on the same street as the hotel, I recommend Ocean's 7 (I just wanted a sandwich that night. They had a grilled chopped chicken one that so inexpensive and HUGE! I couldn't eat it all, but it sure was tasty. My husband had sea bass that he devoured.) and Kathisma (we had the baked mushrooms appetizer and a fish platter for 2 that was outstanding!). We had a great Turkish pizza around the corner from the hotel at the Palatium Cafe. Be sure to go in the courtyard and down into the ruins of the Great Palace of Constantiople (Palatium Magnum). Very awesome and romantic, especially at night. About a five or 10 minute walk from the hotel, and near the tramway, is Mozaik. Best calamari I've ever had. Also near there is Khorasani. We ate there twice. The lamb chops were incredible. Juicy and tender. We also had excellent calamari and fish at the Sultanahmet Fish House. It's walkable (about 15 minutes from the hotel), but if you make a reservation they also have a car service. The owner was super friendly and the service was spot on.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful hotel. all advise!”
Reviews.Author: Nana O
Reviews.Content: wonderful hotel! , Nice big rooms, very clean! feels like home! friendly staff, very hospitable

Reviews.Title: “Home Suite Home”
Reviews.Author: Jkaz1231
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a week in Istanbul over the Christmas holiday and one of the greatest travel experiences of my life. We stayed 5 nights at the Millennium Suites. This boutique hotel is perfectly situated in the Old City, Sultanahmet, exactly where you want to be to enjoy the major sites like the Blue Mosque and Hagia Sofia and is also just a quick hop to the best restaurants, baths and tram line. Our room was big, clean and homey. All that said, the best part about this place is the people. Alper, Arzu and the rest of the staff were the most gracious and generous hotel staff I have ever encountered. Anytime of the day, they were available for questions and advice and a cup of tea. When we asked for a backgammon set, some wine glasses, whatever it was, it was given to us quickly and always with a smile. The breakfasts were comprehensive with baked goods, omelets, salads, etc and delicious. Everything about this experience was more than we could have asked for and we really felt like family was taking care of us. It was hard to say goodbye,. We love Istanbul and the Millennium Suites and can't wait for our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Above and Beyond”
Reviews.Author: adina_allen
Reviews.Content: Wow, what an amazing stay we had at the Millennium Suites! The rooms are spacious, beautiful, and well-appointed, the location is perfectly situated in the heart of the Old City, and the Turkish breakfast each morning is homemade and delicious. But what really sets this hotel apart is its incredible staff. Each and every person we interacted with was knowledgeable, helpful, warm, and welcoming. The staff helped us set up all of our tours, trips, and transportation (Bosphorous cruise, Turkish bath experience, Whirling Dervish performance) so that we could move effortlessly around the city. Whenever we returned back to the hotel from a day out exploring it truly felt like we were coming home. We would hang around in the lobby and talk about our day with the staff, who were always excited to hear about what we'd seen and how our day had been. We traveled with a 1.5 year old and it was amazing to see the staff play with him anytime we were in the lobby. We loved Istanbul and can't wait to return and know exactly where we'll be staying when we come - thanks Millennium Suites for making our trip so special!

Reviews.Title: “Turkish Delight!”
Reviews.Author: Jordan B
Reviews.Content: I will begin by saying that I have never written a review of a hotel, but this experience was so lovely that I wanted to share it with the worldwide web. From the moment we arrived at the Millennium Suites, we were given the best in Turkish hospitality. The rooms are very nice (large, modern, immaculate), and the hotel itself is perfectly located for visiting the major sites in Istanbul's Old City. For all that I could say about the room or the location, what really separates the Millennium Suites from other hotels is its spectacular staff. Alper, the hotel's manager, sets the tone with his warmth, sincerity, and helpfulness and the rest of the staff follows suit. We were traveling with our one and a half year old son, and it honestly felt like we were surrounded by loving family. Every member of the staff was sweet and kind, and they really catered to all of our needs. I could say a lot more, but the bottom line is that it was the best hotel experience I've had. The attention and service that we received were beyond compare. We can't wait to come back! Jordan B. p.s. The breakfast, with its many home-baked treats (thank you, Arzu) and Turkish cheeses was the perfect start to each day.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great services and super clean room.”
Reviews.Author: Ekmal Z
Reviews.Content: The location is great. About 5 minutes walking distance to the blue mosque. If you are a good runner, you can be there in less than a minute. Located in Sultanahmet area where you can find the Hagia Sophia, Grand Bazaar and all the other attractions. We even walked to the spice market from this hotel. You can save your money on transport. Hotel's staffs (Alper & team) are super friendly. Feel free to ask them anything especially recommendations for great restaurants. We went to all three restaurants that were recommended by them and we are really happy with their recommendations. They even arranged the courtesy transfer from hotel to the restaurants and back to the hotel. Don't simply walk into any restaurant since they might charge you the "tourist" price. Always talk to the hotel's staff first. The room is quite nice and relatively new. Room service is superb and they keep the place really clean. You can eat off the floor if you want to. The bed is nice and pillows are super comfy. It is a small boutique hotel which is a good thing where you don't have to queue for breakfast buffet and definitely more food for you i guess. In short, it is a great boutique hotel with great location and friendly people, Ekmal Zazi

Reviews.Title: “Best Management/Staff I've Encountered. Great Location.”
Reviews.Author: Robert K
Reviews.Content: First, by way of context, I fly 80K/year and I spend, on average, 100+ nights/year in hotel rooms. This particular trip was one of the very rare adventures that was purely for pleasure (and on which I was able to bring my wife). We had an absolute blast. If and when I return to Istanbul, I will stay at the Millennium Suites or their sister hotel, Muyan Suites. We stayed in room 402 (top floor). It was incredibly spacious (by American standards, let alone European standards). It was well furnished in an elegant style, clean, well maintained, and in good condition. The television received hundreds of channels (not that you will need to spend a lot of time watching TV in that historic area of Istanbul). The bed was comfortable. The area was surprisingly quiet (given how close to the busy parts of Istanbul the hotel is). The hotel itself is in a great location. It is a 5-10 minute walk from the major sites: Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia, Topkapi Palace, Archaeological Museums, Islamic Art Museum, etc. There are dozens of restaurants and food stands as well as a fairly high-class bazaar within 1-2 city blocks of the front door. So, for a relatively young couple on a middle-class budget who enjoys foreign travel and were looking for a relatively authentic Turkish hotel experience, the Millennium Suites is perfect. But, the real gem of the hotel is the manager (and I think owner?): Alper Ozturk. His staff is is great as well. There was a slight mixup with our reservation (booked through a third party, I'm sure it was partially their fault). So, for the first two of our four nights, the hotel was overbooked. Alper personally met us when we arrived, explained the situation, and then walked us (10 minutes?) to the recently opened sister hotel called Muyan Suites (please note: the pictures are of our room at the Muyan Suites). He offered to drive but we wanted the walk after the long day of flying. He had booked us in a gigantic suite there. He then proceeded to offer us everything and then some (he offered to book us a cruise up the Bosphorus, a free dinner and dancing show at one of the local restaurants catering to tourists, etc.). We did not actually take him up on those as we had a fairly tight schedule already. But, he ended up arranging a private car to take us to the airport when we made a day trip to Izmir and on our last day when we left Istanbul. And by arranged, I mean he paid for it too. On the third day, when it was time to move back to the Millennium Suites from the Muyan Suites, we simply packed our bags and went about our day. The staff moved the bags for us to the Millennium and they were waiting when we arrived just before dinner. Alper was incredibly nice to us...visibly working hard to make our stay a wonderful one. When we left for the airport our last day at 3:30am, Alper even got up to see us off. He presented my wife with a gift of Turkish soaps. Maybe I have been jaded by the so-so attitudes of most American hotel managers, and maybe I had low expectations because it was my first time in Turkey and so I really had no expectations at all. But, Alper made this stay in Istanbul one I will remember forever. Thank you, Alper.

Reviews.Title: “Best Location, Best People”
Reviews.Author: Courtney H
Reviews.Content: I loved my stay at Millennium Suites for so many reasons--the location in the Old City is ideal because you can walk to interesting sites while still being on a small, less-trafficked street. The rooms are beautiful and the hotel is very well kept. The breakfasts are amazing with many fabulous choices of fruits, cheeses, olives, breads, coffees, teas, juices, etc. But the best part about the hotel is the people. Everyone who works there is very kind and very hospitable...I left feeling like I was friends with them, and now I miss them as much as I miss Istanbul!

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location!”
Reviews.Author: wanderlust786
Reviews.Content: The perfect location in sultanahmet. We were met at the airport and that was one of the best decisions. We also got the drop off too. Miss Arzu is the best, made our cook to order eggs with whites only and just a bit of oil, perfectly day after day. We stayed in the ground floor suite. Expected a larger room per the pictures as there were three of us, but we managed. The folding bed isn't the most comfortable, but can you expect it to be? The staff make this place! We were personally greated by Taner. The room was very clean and the flowers in the room were a great touch. I liked the personal care box that contained loofahs! I would recommend this hotel and would consider staying here again. Please go to doy-doy restaurant, they deliver!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Awesome staff!”
Reviews.Author: John B
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed my five days in Turkey and choosing this hotel is part of the reason! The room was very comfortable and had a great outdoor private patio. Had it not been winter, I would have loved spending some relaxation time out there with a great book. Very convenient to all of the sites - was able to walk everywhere or take the tramway. Best of all however was the staff. They truly were concerned about the well-being of each guest! The reception staff was always ready to greet me by name and ask me about my day. The breakfast was great and the chef, Arzu, was fantastic. What a great personality. Thanks to Alper (X 2), Ugur, Somer, and Arzu for making my stay so welcome!

Reviews.Title: “IN ONE WORD PERFECT”
Reviews.Author: larisalondon l
Reviews.Content: A nice hotel centrally located in the old city.Millennium Suites has only 7 spacious so clean rooms and very friendly staff. Breakfast is served as a buffet and More than i expected.the staff never let you go out hungry even you wake up too late and miss the breakfast time without any extra charge.after breakfast always possible to have a cup of turkish coffee with turkish delights. It is really a few minutes away to the most important historical sights,Topkapi Palace,Hagia Sophia Museum,The Blue Mosque and grand bazaar is with in walking distance.the tram station is also so close to the hotel but always too crowded so never advise you to choose to somewhere else.Taxi might be a much better option and really cheap . We will of course back to the Millennium and Istanbul,highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely the Best!!!”
Reviews.Author: cajonjon
Reviews.Content: First of all, the room and bathroom were by European standards very large and well appointed and were kept spotlessly clean by the very capable housekeeper. The room and bathroom were equipped with everything one needs at a hotel. As many others have said, the hotel is very conveniently located within walking distance to all of the major sites. Secondly, the owner and hotel staff could not have been nicer and kinder to us! They made us feel like family and we will always think of them as part of our family. We have to send special thanks to Taner (our new #1 son), lovely Arzu who keeps breakfast going so well every morning, Soner (who is going to be a great chef someday), Alper (who always welcomed us back in the evening with a smile) and many thanks to the owner Mr. Alper for being such a good businessman and recognizing and hiring such a fantastic staff! Again, a million thanks to the Millenium Suites for making Istanbul so wonderful for us! With Fondest Regards, John and DiAnne

Reviews.Title: “surprised by joy : )”
Reviews.Author: WheelsUp!
Reviews.Content: At first I was disappointed. The reviews had been so good. The rooms looked so big. Turns out, it's a small hotel with HUGE heart. The staff is amazingly kind and helpful and they go out of their way to inform. The location could not be more convenient. And it's SPOTLESSLY clean. We would not hesitate to return; we felt as if we had made friends in a culture that was foreign to us.

Reviews.Title: “great service, good location,a bit pricey”
Reviews.Author: laluce81
Reviews.Content: They were lovely hosts, met us at the airport which was a great idea. Very helpful w/ local info and superb travel agency introduction.It was an anniversary trip & they gave us a pretty vase of flowers. The breakfast girl is a darling!! the first floor room very quiet w/ a tiny patio.The location is brilliant w/ lots of resturarants,sights and shops nearby..Great for travelers on their first visit.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Prague, Hlavni Mesto Praha, Czech Republic
Reviews.Title: “Nice little hotel, superb location, excellent service”
Reviews.Author: Michal P
Reviews.Content: Me and my wife spent 3 nights in this lovely hotel. As we were having our 10th anniversary I asked the hotel service to prepare some flowers and a bottle of champaign for our arrival - my wife was so surprised! The hotel staff was also very helpful when finding locations to visit as well as when we needed some tips on how to negotiate the price on the marketplace. Both airport transfers were managed by them we had nothing to worry about. When we left home we forgot something at the hotel and the manager arranged posting it via UPS. I could go on, but I would be just repeating other reviews. If you're looking for a nice small hotel close to all important attractions with really helpful hotel staff, you should definitely consider choosing this one.

Reviews.Title: “Istanbul 8 day stay”
Reviews.Author: RobertA60899
Reviews.Content: Although not a suite a very large, well appointed hotel room. The location is perfect, walking distance to many restaurants, sites, shopping and the T1 Tram that will take you to just about anything you would want to see in Istanbul. Staff was friendly, helpful, warm, they stood everytime you want into the lobby. Good breakfast (real coffee). Would go back without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Great Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: rogers222
Reviews.Content: The Millennium Suites is a small hotel just around the corner from the Blue Mosque. It's on a terrific street with dozens of restaurants and nice hotels. An easy walk for visitors to the bazaars, mosques, and palaces in the upscale Sultanahmet neighborhood. The property is less than two years old, so it is new and fresh and stylish with nice rooms and new bathrooms. The staff is terrific, discreet, and polite -- very well trained and attentive to guest needs. The small included breakfast, served in the lobby, is fine. The price is good. There is wi-fi, the rooms are quiet, and only two rooms per floor. A nice hotel, I will go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great 8-day stay”
Reviews.Author: JohnKWHo
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just spent 8 great nights at this boutique hotel. Located just 5 minutes from the Aya Sophia, the Blue Mosque and Tokapi Palace, it is very convenient to the sights especially if one is tight on time. A 10mins walk will get you to the Sultanahmet tram stop which will get one to most of the other tourist sights. The hotel only has 7 rooms on 4 floors; no lifts. The hotel staff are more than happy to carry your luggage to your rooms but request for the sole ground floor room if you have issues walking up stairs. The rooms are quite spacious, two on each floor. The hotel is less than 2 years old, so everything is new and working. The room was kept clean and tidy by a very efficient maid. If you desire quietness, I recommend the rooms facing the rear. There's no views though. The hotel is on a street that is occupied by a community of mostly hotels and restaurants and a couple of excursion companies. This is an excellent cozy hotel where the staff knows you and vice versa. The team is extremely helpful and friendly. The two receptionists that served us, Alper and Taner, were both great conversationalists and gave us many helpful tips. At breakfast, we were served by Arzu. She lights up every morning with her bubbly personality and taught us Turkish phrases at every meal! She did not give up until we got it right! One thing to note is that they only serve breakfast, but there're restaurants up and down the street. All in all I would thoroughly recommend this hotel if you like small cozy hotels without the frills of a pool, hamam or a breath-taking view.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Disapp0inted09
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have just returned from a very enjoyable six day break to Istanbul. We stayed at the Millennium Suites having read the previous travelers reports on Trip Advisor. It is extremely difficult to add anything original to previous reviews! In an ideal position for a trip to this incredible city. The hotel is small in size but big on everything else! Large comfortable, extremely clean and well maintained rooms. The beds are so comfortable with luxury bedding , the bathroom was modern and equipped with lovely soft towels and a fantastic powerful shower with endless supplies of hot water. The staff were extremely friendly and helpful and always available to offer advice. The location is in the heart of the Sultanhmet district within walking distance of the Blue Mosque, Topkapi Palace and Aya Sophia. A large selection of good eating places literally on your doorstep. A special mention to the Metropolis restaurant opposite, the food was so good we returned for a second visit. Would definitely stay again at the Millennium Suites and would have no hesitation in recommending it to other visitors to Istanbul;

Reviews.Title: “The Best Hotel in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: anginsan-01
Reviews.Content: I consider the Millennium Suites the best boutique hotel I have ever stayed in during by travels. The location is superb, just a block away from the Hagia Sophia and the Blue Mosque along a street filled with restaurants and shops. There is a wonderful little bazaar just around the corner and Topkapi Palace is five minutes away. The rest of the major sites in the Sutanament area are easily within walking distance. The rooms are very large for a boutique hotel with ours being at least 350 sq ft or more. They were clean, nicely decorated and comfortable. However, if you do get a â€œfrontâ€™ room, of which there are three, bring your ear plugs, because since the street has many restaurants it does get noisy at night until around eleven oâ€™clock. This did not bother either me or my wife, but it could some. So if you want quiet ask for a â€œrearâ€� room if available. The breakfast was good considering there are only seven rooms in the hotel. But what makes the Millennium Suites a notch above all the rest is the staff. From Arzu, the breakfast chef, to Taner, the day receptionist/coinsurer, I have not met a friendlier, more accommodating staff anywhere. We would come in from site seeing in the afternoon and the staff would have coffee and snacks out for us. We would sit and drink wine and talk to the staff for hours before going out to dinner. We enjoyed the staff as much as we enjoyed the sites. They made a great hotel even better. I would highly recommend if you are going to Istanbul to make the Millennium Suites your place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “â€œCharming Hotel, Good Location, Great Breakfast, Best Staff â€�”
Reviews.Author: khristian14
Reviews.Content: Amazing, Quaint, Intimate Hotel. This intimate hotel is beautifully designed with open French glass doors, through a cafe leading upwards to a hidden spiral staircase, which brings you to your suite. Each floor houses 2 suites each, all creating such a warm ambience. Charming Staff, all extremely proficient in their duties, they all go over and beyond their call of duty to ensure our stay was the best. They offer extra service whether in assisting with dining recommendations or taking personalised orders for breakfast and or housekeeping requests. Accommodation: rooms were tastefully and artistically decorated. The bed was comfortable with the perfect set of pillows, all snuggled in soft linen. Trendy styled bathroom. Breakfast was first class, a delicious choice of fruit, cereals or special hot orders from the chef. Kudos and a special applaud to the waitress, her smiling face radiated such hospitality to the room. Location, ideal within minutes of walking distance to the main attractions of Istanbulâ€™s beautiful â€œold cityâ€�. (Blue Mosque, Aga Sophia) We highly recommend this boutique hotel to anyone planning a trip to Istanbulâ€™s Old City. We would most definitely stay at this hotel again. Special thanks to Millennium Suites for making our stay precious and cherished in Istanbul. M/M Dove

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home”
Reviews.Author: AussieBeth55
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in the Milleniium for 4 nights and was extremely happy with my stay. The hotel is in a small cobble stone street in a quaint area of town walking distance from the Blue Mosque, Sofia Palace, museum, and trams to travel further afield. The entrance to the hotel is through their quaint cafe where you end up spending much of your time when you come 'home' for meals, taking a break over a coffee or wine, or just resting and watching the world stroll by. The staff are absolutely trustworthy, extremely efficient and have a great way of being friendly, relaxed yet professional and always keen to help and advise. The rooms were meticulously clean and nicely furnished, quiet, everything worked perfecty. The food in the cafe/restaurant was Italian style and was beautiful, good healthy, nourishing food to keep you going and i normally came 'home' for meals. Reasonably priced. Breakfast was included in the price. Did i say the staff really just couldnt do enough for you, without being gushy or overbearing. Very nice people. We stayed in Istanbul for a week and i found 3-4 days was enough in Sultanmet and then we moved up to the newer part of the city so it was good to have the variety, though you could easily stay there as a base.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful little hotel with excellent service in the heart of Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Charlie S
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for only two nights but it was really a beautiful place, very clean, ideally located because very close to the main sights in the heart of Istanbul. What makes this little hotel so special is not only its atmosphere and delicious breakfast but the team that was extremely friendly and was always helpful when information about the town etc. was needed. I would definitely stay there again and can recommend Millennium Suites to everyone who is looking for a pleasant stay in a hotel with a friendly atmosphere!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, well-located hotel with large rooms”
Reviews.Author: benjin
Reviews.Content: This hotel is well-located only a few blocks from the major tourist sights and on a relatively quiet street lined with sidewalk cafes. It is small, I think maybe only 7 rooms. The rooms are beautifully decorated and quite large. The AC works fabulously well. Breakfast was excellent. The staff were helpful. Absolutely no complaints. We greatly enjoyed our time in Istanbul; it is a fascinating city!

Reviews.Title: “A bit of a jewel!”
Reviews.Author: Peter P
Reviews.Content: We spent 8 days at the Millennium Suites. It is a real find, perfectly located with a staff that aims to please. All the rooms are large and well equipped. After a one-night stay on the first floor suite (too dark for us), we moved to room 402 facing the street. Our concerns about street noise were misplaced. The Topkapi palace, Blue Mosque and Hagia Sofia are within quick walking distance. The hotel's restaurant is good to very good. We have been privileged to stay in some of the best hotels in the world (typically on an expense account). Despite its petite scale, our stay at the Millennium Suites ranks in our memories with grander hotels. We hope to get back to Istanbul and there will be no question as to where we will stay.

Reviews.Title: “You Will Like This Hotel In Istanbul!”
Reviews.Author: mustang649
Reviews.Content: I just had the pleasure of staying in this hotel for a week and I thoroughly enjoyed it and can only echo the comments of many other fellow travelers who have reviewed this hotel on TripAdvisor! I was here on business, but it is a great little hotel for most of the major attractions in Istanbul and I actually selected it because if its location. It is within walking distance of the Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia, Topkapi Palace and many more places. It is also within an 8-10 minute walk of the tram, (Sultanahmet Station) which is a very good and cheap way to get around Istanbul. It costs only 2 Turkish Lira for a one-way ticket anywhere. It's also a good way to go to the port, if you're taking a cruise. It was so convenient that I didn't even use my rental car the whole time I was here. The hotel is very comfortable and the bed is one of the most comfortable I have ever slept in, in a hotel, and I travel a lot! The towels are Turkish towels - large and very soft! The shower is spacious by European standards and the room is larger than most European hotel rooms. The Wi-Fi worked great in the room! The breakfast is free and good - they even make omelets for you! The only drawback is the fact that the hotel has no elevator and only one of the rooms is on the ground floor. The other rooms are located on the other three floors of the hotel, but Taner, or one of the other clerks, will graciously carry your bags to your room. The hotel is situated on one of the most popular streets in the Sultanahmet area and is surrounded by numerous shops, restaurants and other hotels. You won't go hungry and you'll have plenty of places to contribute to the economy of Istanbul! The best thing about this hotel is the people! Alper, the Manager, is the consummate professional and very conscientious about his hotel and his guests. Taner, one of the front desk clerks, has a smile as wide as the Bosphorus and is a very courteous and helpful young man. He has a university degree and is actually a licensed tour guide, so he's a great source for finding out where to go, how to get there and what to do, in Istanbul. I had a wonderful visit here and I would come back here again and would highly recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect little hotel”
Reviews.Author: Diana E
Reviews.Content: What a great little hotel. Very comfortable room (I now realise I need new pillows at home!), great breakfasts served by bubbly and efficient waitress, very convenient location for all the things we wanted to visit in a 4 day stay. Lots of restaurants and cafes nearby. The service was cheerful and really excellent, including sustained help with sorting out a charging mistake at a nearby restaurant, for which we are very grateful. Thoroughly recommend, even more so if a good price deal is on offer.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel close to the main attractions”
Reviews.Author: Glenn R
Reviews.Content: Just ended a short break to Istanbul where we stayed at the Millennium Suites. Staff were lovely and very helpful. The hotel is easy walking distance to Hagia Sofia / Blue Mosque / Topkapi Palace in an area which while obviously tailored for tourists is nonetheless a great spot to relax on a lounge with cocktail or a shisha pipe. The hotel itself is very small, but the rooms are large, well appointed, comfortable, very clean and with quiet and efficient aircon. The beds are super comfortable and the bathrooms have terrific showers to blast away the dust from the days sightseeing with high pressure hot water and a nice amenities pack, though no moisturiser which is a small oversight. There is a small restaurant / bar at the front of the hotel with outdoor seating which is perfect for a cold beer or a late lunch. A small but nice breakfast buffet is also served here with omelette made on demand. We also booked a tour of the main historical sights through the hotel and this was very useful in getting some historical background and bypassing some of the queues although you don't get much time to take photo's along the way. You may not get the views or the pools and bars of a big hotel here, but you really can't beat it for friendliness, service and convenience. I was staying in a room by myself and so I didn't think the price was especially good value but nonetheless I definitely recommend. One small gripe - it may say that you get a free airport transfer but that is only from Ataturk - not Sabiha, which costs â‚¬60 cash. This may seem like a lot, but when you get stuck in Istanbul traffic for 2.5 hours it begins to look cheap!

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mike W
Reviews.Content: On the reviews on Trip Advisor we spent 3 days at this wonderful hotel. A great location and staff made our first trip to Istanbul an unforgettable experience. They organized airport pick ups and walking tours of the main attractions. We can hardly wait to visit again. Thanks Taner and all the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Peace and quiet, but close to all the action”
Reviews.Author: fourbigkids
Reviews.Content: Had a lovely time at Millenium Suites in Istanbul. Akbiyik is a busy street full of restaurants and boutique hotels, close to the main attractions in Sultanahmet. The rooms are quite and peaceful. The furnishings are very new and in pristine condition. The large rooms are kept spotlessly clean and the staff cannot do enough for you. Quality continental and 'serve yourself' breakfast with omlettes to order, a great start for the day. The in-house restaurant serves an interesting combination of Italian and Turkish meals. The Italian was a welcome change after a week of kebap and barbequed aubergine! Recommend this small hotel highly. Thanks Tanir and the team at Millenium Suites.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice!”
Reviews.Author: MIKSTV
Reviews.Content: My travel agent wife and I chose this hotel for its reviews and location. What a great welcome to Istanbul! Not only was the pickup at the airport efficient and friendly, but the welcome at the hotel was warm and inviting. We had a gorgeous room on the third floor (puff-puff), overlooking the street. Lots of fun opening the window, peering down on the street action below. Alper (the pony-tailed one...there are 2) was a great host, he and his staff could not do more for us, inlcuidng lugging our 3 heavy suitcases up the winding staircase (this was the first stop of a 19 day trip). Location close to all attractions is great. Blue Mosque, Hagia Sofia, Topkaki Palace, waterfront all within short walk. The Turks in general are very warm and friendly folks. We hired a private guide for 2 days who got us into everything needed, right to the front of the lines :) Thanks Alper and staff for making our arrival and stay most enjoyable and welocming!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful small hotel”
Reviews.Author: Susan C
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 4 lovely days at the Millenium Suites in September 2011. This is just the nicest small hotel; wonderful staff; large well decorated room; execellent location; the owner and his staff were the nicest we have met in our world travels; they assisted us in setting up a great local private tour guide, arranged dinners at restaurants with free shuttle service and made our stay an enjoyable memory; we certainly hope we can return again one day. If you are planning on staying in the Sultanahmet area of town you could not do better at any price!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: maclamb
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 nights in this lovely small hotel with 3 friends. We received a courtesy pick up and return trip to the airport and were looked after by the most friendly, helpful and knowledgable staff at the hotel. Our (many) requests were met always with a friendly smile, and we were made most welcome. Our rooms were impecably clean, large and had beautiful bathrooms. Really good beds. The other plus point is its location, a short walk to the Blue Mosque, Aya Sofya and Topkapi Palace. The Grand Bazaar is also walkable, around 15 mins (shortest route). Located in a buzzy vibrant street with lots of restaurants to choose from. Breakfast and meals at the hotel were very good too. Would stay here again and would recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: “Best experience”
Reviews.Author: Grande_Muraille
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with my friends and we had a great time. The staff was not only friendly and very helpful, but also very informative as well. We usually don't use travel agents for our tour and the hotel staff provided a lot of useful information which makes our days much easy and enjoyable. We appreciate this hotel and definitely stay here when we will be back to Istanbul again in future.

Reviews.Title: “Seven Nights at Millennium Suites”
Reviews.Author: clayontheroad
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent seven nights at Millennium Suites last week. As described in all other reviews, the hotel staff is outstanding and location is perfect. Breakfast offered a nice variety of fruits, cereal, meats, and omlettes are available if requested (I suggest asking, they were very good). Alper, who runs the desk during the day (as opposed to Alper the manager), offered great suggestions and made several of our arrangements for us. All went smoothly. Our room was fine in size, the bed was extremely comfortable, and the bathroom was well appointed. We have traveled to Europe several times and always stay at boutique hotels found through Trip Advisor. This was the first hotel where the shower worked perfect! One thing to keep in mind. We stayed in Room 401 on the top floor. It's 52 steps up a circular staircase to get there. If you need to lose 30 pounds like me, then the exercise is not a bad thing! However, folks who have trouble climbing stairs may want to request a room on a lower floor. Our room faced the alley and we never heard street noise or the morning call to prayer. We slept very soundly with no interruptions. Alper (the hotel manager) understands that good customer service is more than just a smiling staff and clean towels. Our reservation had an unconventional aspect and he handled it wonderfully. When the back office runs as well as the front of the house, then you know you have spent your money with good people. If you consider these issues important, then Millennium Suites is an outstanding value and we would certainly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “More than pleased”
Reviews.Author: James C
Reviews.Content: Great location, friendly staff, nice, well-maintained room in a boutique hotel. Ample fresh breakfast. The location is close ( a few short blocks) to many major attractions. Even the Grand Bazaar is within easy walking distance. We were only in Istanbul for two nights and had plenty to do and see locally and never had to resort to a taxi. The narrow street is home to mainly small hotels and street-side restaurants. The Metropolis restaurant (within throwing distance of the hotel) was our favorite. Some restaurants have a rooftop option with a view of the Bosporus. The cobblestone street is quiet in the morning and bustling later in the day (no sidewalk but fun to walk). The room was street-side and we worried about evening noise but it was no problem and fun to look out on the action. We would stay there again and would not change a thing (except, perhaps, a lower floor).

Reviews.Title: “Great time.”
Reviews.Author: Kareem40
Reviews.Content: When I had to find a hotel, after extending our stay in Istanbul, I found this hotel with a high rating. Few hours After completing my booking, I received a call from the hotel manager, extending his apologies that one of the rooms needs some maintenance that will involve little paint, which will cause a probably fumes. So he offered me to pick me up from the airport, reserving two rooms in an adjacent hotel, holding the same class, and cupones for a free tour, and a free dinner... The offer was hard to resist. Reaching the adjacent hotel, the Millennium hotel manager was waiting for us, and helped me check in, and when we got to the rooms we found two beautiful flower bouquets, with the compliments of the millennium hotel. At that time I knew why Millennium hotel is getting the high ratings, even before I step a foot in the hotel; it is the beautiful welcome and the help that they are very happy to extend to their clients. Having children with us, I needed some extra help, so when I checked the next morning in the hotel, I was given choices to be upgraded, but I didn't want that, we wanted rooms close to each other, so we were given two rooms in one floor (the hotel has only two rooms each floor) and from the stair way you had to open a door to walk to the landing area where the two rooms were, so we had that small hall, our room doors were open, and we had our self a beautiful flat! We all had a great time! All staff were friendly and helpful, and made us feel welcomed.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, friendly, small hotel in Sultanamet.”
Reviews.Author: Marie G
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Millennium Suites recently and we would definitely stay there again. The room was comfortable and quiet; the staff were very friendly and helpful. The location was wonderful: Akbiyik is a vibrant street in the Sultanamet district which enfolds Byzantine ruins and is filled with Ottoman buildings. Many amazing places including the Hagia Sophia are a pleasant stroll away. We would love to return soon!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome location, awesome staff.”
Reviews.Author: 50CountriesSoFar
Reviews.Content: The staff at Millennium are what set it apart. In a word, they are amazing. I have never been greeted so warmly and treated so pleasantly in a hotel, and I've stayed at my fair share of Four Seasons and the like (which, by the way, there is one around the corner so that says a lot about the location!). The value for money is excellent, and their Italian chef serves up a great pizza margherita if you are in the mood, and does an equally find job with Turkish fare. I enjoyed sitting at one of their lovely tables on the street watching the world go by while reading my guide app planning my day. The street is full of many tourist friendly hotels and restaurants so you can be completely in your comfort zone if you are a little nervous about coming to Turkey. Thanks for a wonderful stay!

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT !!!!”
Reviews.Author: SetianDim
Reviews.Content: Excellent Location, very close to Sultanhmet Square. The service was perfect and we will stay there during our next visit to Istanbul. Julia Athens, Greece

Reviews.Title: “Heart of Istanbul Old City”
Reviews.Author: KKQueen
Reviews.Content: This is a real treasure situated right in the heart of Sultanamet, within minutes of Topkapi, Hagia Sofia and Blue Mosque. The hotel may be small but beautifully organised, spotless spacious rooms, with kettle and refreshments. Lovely toiletries provided. Very comfortable bed. The staff are very welcoming and friendly, and very happy to help with suggested sight-seeing routes. The restaurant is mainly Italian but we had the Turkish Specialties and they were delicious. All in all, we would recommend this hotel, and would definately hope to return again.

Reviews.Title: “You Will Feel Welcome”
Reviews.Author: IlanDC
Reviews.Content: We received a very pleasant welcome from Taner, the rooms manager, upon arrival, and without asking he offered us an upgraded room with a large patio. What we didn't realize upon check-in is that Taner's good English is unusual in Turkey, even in cosmopolitan Istanbul. The rooms (only 7 of them) are clean and nicely renovated, and the insulated windows are important since the hotel is located on a street with many bars and restaurants that play music until late at night. Within 10 minutes, you can walk to Topkapi, Ayasofya, the Blue Mosque, and the Basilica Cisterns -- or take the T1 tram to any of the other sites (like the newer Istanbul Modern art museum). The hotel features a comprehensive breakfast, including omelettes made to order, and their pizza is very good. All the staff are warm and friendly, and I would highly recommend this hotel if you enjoy staying in a nice location and interacting with the local staff.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: nirtak99
Reviews.Content: For a stay in Sultanahmet, the location of the Millennium suites can't be beat. Easy walking distance to all of the major sites, located near lots of restaurants and a lively street. The room itself was large and clean and suited us just fine, and the hospitality was also very good, with Alper even preparing a plate of fruit for our hungry 2 year old after an arrival after midnight.

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly, warm and kind staff”
Reviews.Author: Suat T
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Millennium Suites for 5 days (family of 4, parents plus children 10 and 12). We booked one room but they surprised us with two rooms. The rooms were clean and comfortable. The Millennium is perfectly located nearby Sultanahmet, Hagia Sophia (Aya Sofya) and Topkapi. The hotel offers a very tasty Italian/Turkish cuisine. Ask the Chef for something special and he will prepare something delightful. The staff is friendly, warm and very kind. Arzu, Taner, Pusat, Soner, both Alpers and off course the chef de cuisine: I'm looking forward to meet you again very soon in this inspiring city Istanbul. Thank you all for the hospitality!

Reviews.Title: “HÄ°GHLY RECOMMENDED”
Reviews.Author: sehzadem_27_
Reviews.Content: There are not enough superlatives to rate this hotel. It is the Best Hotel experience. We have ever had. The Hotel has 3 floors. The room was amazing and spacious and the service impeccable. The staff are genuinely interested in how you are finding your stay. Service, Friendliness, Cleanliness, Food quality cant be matched at any other Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “what a fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: annieob66
Reviews.Content: i booked the millennium suites hotel for my husbands birthday and what a find we could not praise it enough .all the attractions right on the doorstep .the hotel staff were brilliant so friendly and helpfull they made my husbands birthday extra special and also provided a birthday cake .we loved the size of the rooms and the tea/coffee facility were a welcome bonus as for istanbul what a fantastic city it is definitely going back and most definitely staying at the millennium suites . thanks to all the staff for making our break so memorable from ann and george obrien

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel in old city!”
Reviews.Author: clarabautista
Reviews.Content: we enjoyed the millennium suites.this hotel is small but has a big rooms and very clean..the staffs are very friendly.if you are stay in millennium suites,your holiday will be great.because this hotel location is very easy and you can walk everywhere in sultanahmet.

Reviews.Title: “small and great hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: paoalonso
Reviews.Content: this hotel is really small but the atmosphere is very nice.service is excellent!The hotel staffs are very friendly and helpful.we stayed 5days,everything is very clean.this hotel location is very good.we went to walkable to everywhere in sultanahmet.we liked this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Abudhabi2010
Reviews.Content: I spent a night in Istanbul on my way back to Abu Dhabi from Prague. The hotel is in a wonderful location at the heart of the city. The room I was staying at was absolutely gorgeous, very clean and very very comfortable. I strongly recommend the hotel if you want to have a place where you can relax but at the same time be at the center of all action!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place to stay”
Reviews.Author: kitesurferPerth
Reviews.Content: Very helpful and considerate staff. Large rooms, well furnished with very comfortable bed. Excellent location

Reviews.Title: “Welcome back!”
Reviews.Author: Mikers_P
Reviews.Content: I was staying with Millenium suites for second time. There were no significant changes in the hotel since our last visit (August, 2010), but they started Italian restaurant with perfect cuisine and great choice of pizzas!! The hotel is located very good - few steps from Aya Sofia and Blue Mosque, the historical center of the City! I can 100000% recommend the hotel for the great staying! And don't forget to book a airport transfer - they do it perfect! Wish you a good luck, Millenium suites!

Reviews.Title: “Very good”
Reviews.Author: Luca D
Reviews.Content: We (my family and I) spent 2 days in the Millenium Suites. The hotel is strategically located, close to the main tourist sites. The rooms are large and clean (everything is almost new). The staff is really friendly and helpful. What to ask more ? I definitely recommend this hotel, and we will be back next time we come to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and very friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: JW10_11
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as a family of four and couldn't have been better looked after. Milleniium Suites is ideally located for the main tourist sites in the old town of Istanbul which are easily walkable. The street is full of restaurants and bars which have a lovely atmosphere at night and unlike one of the reviewers, we had no problems with noise at night and we were staying in street side rooms. The staff here are very friendly and welcoming and very attentive. We would definitely recommend Millenium Suites to anyone visiting the tourist sites of Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, comfortable and clean boutique hotel.”
Reviews.Author: hktransplant
Reviews.Content: We are a family of 9 (aged 3.5 to adults), stayed at the hotel for 4 days, and we occupied 3 rooms out of 7 rooms available. All the rooms are quite consistent: clean, good sized and comfortable. The hotel staffs are very friendly and helpful. If you don't mind to negotiate the stairs, the experience is comparable to the much more expensive hotel (1 room is available on the G/F). Overall, it is an enjoyable experience with all the major sights located nearby / walking distance. Will come back for sure if we are to visit Istanbul again.

Reviews.Title: “Great small boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lucy321
Reviews.Content: A terrific boutique hotel experience with great beds and great staff. Situated in the "old town" a short walk from all the tourist must sees. Every day when we came back from sight-seeing we were grateful of the hotel's position and the staff. They seemed like family and were always very welcoming. We would recommend this hotel to anyone who wanted to be within walking distance to all the tourist sites.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice small hotel”
Reviews.Author: Panguin
Reviews.Content: If you want to be around the Sultanahmet area, and the price is right--like when I booked several months ago, not what I now see on TA--consider this hotel. The road where the hotel is located, Akbiyik Street, is/was apparently a backpacker's alley. You will see many young people pulling their luggage along the road and there a few places with the label "hostel" emblazoned across them. MS, Senatus next door, Byzantiium across the road, are one of several hotels along the stretch. At the end of the road where the hotel is located, there is a taxi-stand, which makes things convenient. Although I'm puzzled why 9 of 10 taxi drivers did not know the street. So on the one hand, this means that there are a lot of shops and facilities catering to tourists. There is a laundry shop down the road opposite the taxi stand. There are a couple of tour companies on and around Akbiyik. Even a Turkish bath. There is a range of restaurants. The BalikÃ§i Sabahattin is right and down the road from the hotel. Up the hill towards Sultanahmet are ATMs that can give you your cash in euros and US dollars. On the other hand, it can get busy till pretty late. So if you do book a hotel along the strip, be sure the window is double-glazed. The windows of Millenium Suites apparently are. Also on the same other hand, do not expect much by way of facilities. MS has no gym (not even an elevator), no pool, no shop, just a restaurant. Reception doubles as the tour booking desk. There are only seven rooms in the entire hotel. In my book, a small hotel does not automatically a boutique hotel make. But it does make for a friendly atmosphere. Breakfast can be tailored to your taste albeit up to a point.
