It's very pleasant to sit on the patio for breakfast. The room I had was not particularly large although I gather from friends who dropped by that it was large by Istanbul standards. It is not, however, a room to spend an extended period of time at work unless you can work on a square wheeled ottoman (there, wanted to use the word in talking about a place in Istanbul). MS has comfortable slippers. Bathroom amenities are sufficient. The bathroom is a a little tight but comfortable. Water pressure is good. The shower stall's doors are water-tight. A small snag is the lack of a hook on the back of the door. Service is the highlight of the hotel. Staff generally go out of the way to get you what you want? No bread? They walk to a bakery nearby to get it for you. No plums? They borrow from a restaurant. Twice. Booking a tour? No problem. If the price fits, go for it. You may expect friendly service but nothing by way of facilities. And when going by taxi, stop at the Byzantium hotel because the MS signage is small and my car missed the hotel. Twice.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Runaustralia
Reviews.Content: A really nice small hotel in the centre of the action. Large spacious rooms.Service is excellent.We had the 2 rooms on the second floor 1 for our children and the other for my wife and I.With out hesitation would gladly recommend if you are used to 4 or 5 star accomadation this place is for you. Very central position close to al tourist attractions.5 minute easy walk.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended, what a lovely place”
Reviews.Author: Rigante
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a 3 day weekend in Istanbul where I stayed at the Millennium Suites. I can happily say that this was one of the most pleasant stays I've had at any hotel. First of all, the location is perfect for a first time trek into the beautiful maze that is Istanbul. It is located about a 5 mins walk from the Blue Mosque, Aya Sofia and the plenty other sites nearby. Akbiyik Cadessi is a very cool street in the centre of Sultanahmet that contains countless restaurants and cafes where you can drink, smoke a water pipe and eat some very excellent food. When I first arrived I was greeted by Alper (there are two Alpers, this was the long haired Alper) who took my bags and had a nice breakfast spread out so it was a good way to start my trip. The owner, Alper (short hair), is a very welcoming and nice guy, I was late for breakfast one morning so he brought me out a Turkish coffee and we ate a couple pizzas cooked by the chef in the hotels Italian restaurant. They were fantastic, the chef used to live in Italy and it shows. I spent almost a year in Italy myself and the pizza brought me right back there! We chatted and had some good conversation as if we'd been friends for a long time. I stayed in room 202, one of two suites on the second floor. The room I had was really great. It's surprisingly large and the bed was very comfortable. There's a flatscreen tv and the wireless internet was very fast. The bathroom is also very good, everything is nice, new and modern. Not to mention the water pressure from the shower is fantastic! Akbiyik Cadessi can be a pretty busy place in the evenings but I couldn't tell from my room, the windows are well sealed and I could barely hear a thing, I slept like a baby. I would definitely recommend this place, Alper and his team really make you feel at home there, and it didn't feel forced whatsoever. The Turkish people are very welcoming and this hotel is definitely a perfect showcase of that quality!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Staff, Clean Large Rooms, Wonderful Experience, We Miss It!”
Reviews.Author: diytrying
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I spent 6 great nights here and to repeat what previous travelers have said, this is a wonderful small hotel. The room and bathroom are large and extremely clean with lots of extra quality toiletries, the beds and pillows are extremely comfortable, air-conditioning works well and is quiet and the location is perfect. Only two rooms on our floor so it was quiet except for a little street noise. Lots of good restaurants and sights within easy walking distance. And the WIFI was free and reliable. But what makes it really special is the staff. I can't say enough about how accommodating and pleasant they were, from Alper the manager,( who gave us an extra tram pass he had) to the men at the desk who met every request quickly and extremely courteously. No one would let us carry anything up or down the stairs. They even held breakfast for us the first morning because we overslept. Plenty to choose from at breakfast and Arzu is the very best.....her smile and friendliness will make every breakfast the perfect start to the day. We missed you guys at breakfast the next day too and can't wait to come back.

Reviews.Title: “Small but very friendly and efficient staff run a really neat, little hotel in prime location”
Reviews.Author: abbeylands
Reviews.Content: MS is a small hotel, run efficiently by a small and very friendly staff, who are conscientious and accommodating. Both the rooms we stayed in were spacious and well lit. All the basic amenities worked well. The location is great for accessing virtually every part of the old city. The stairs were a bit of a slog for my old man, so we moved to the one room on the ground floor: folks with dodgy knees and hips should therefore beware. But altogether we had a great time.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location, nice rooms”
Reviews.Author: dugu99
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located close to all major attractions, and the street that the hotel is on is lined with restaurants (some very highly rated on TripAdvisor) and very lively at night. The room is nicely decorated and air-conditioned. The breakfast is quite delicious. The staff are courteous and helpful. Overall I enjoyed the experience and will stay here again. Just a note: skip the hotel transfer, which at 25 Euro is not worth the money, since taxis to or from the airport (Ataturk) costs only ~36 TL (or 15 Euro).

Reviews.Title: “'' in the centre of the history where east meets west & Luxury and well known Turkish hospitality''”
Reviews.Author: lucas1985
Reviews.Content: Istanbul is a unique city where east meets west.We decided to spend more time for a comfortable small hotel.The location is perfect, 100 yards from the Topkapi Palace and 200 yards from Hagia Sophia and the Blue mosque and the cistern as well. Excellent sound proof rooms.Hotel staff is so hospitable , friendly and helpfull.High marks to Millennium and its team.We have already decided to visit Istanbul again next year and definetely will stay in this nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A gem of a place in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: indiancouple
Reviews.Content: Hotels can be impersonal, especially in a large city...but not this one. It exceeded all our expectations, and left a very nice feeling in our minds. It is superbly located in the heart of Sultanahmet, on a street which is lined with hotels and restaurants. It is a hop skip away from the Blue Mosque, the Aya Sofya and the Topkapi Palace. What floored us completely was the size of the rooms, which were palatial, and the decor was absolutely fantastic. The bathrooms were large and well stocked with toiletries. The free wi-fi worked like a charm. There were even fresh flowers placed in the room ! The trappings make you feel you are in a 5-star property, whereas the price is most reasonable. Just could not believe that we got such rooms at such a price. Learned that the hotel is just 10 months old. Its manager is also its part-owner, a young 31 year old man called Alper. He runs the hotel with his heart, and it shows in every part of his dealing. When we reached, he was waiting for us with the bad news that due to some goof-up, they had overbooked for the day, and we would have to spend the first night (out of 4 nights) in a hotel across the street. Just when we were about to scream, he pacified us by saying that this first night's stay would be free, and he was also throwing in a free Bosphorus cruise to make up for the mistake ! Now this was going beyond the call of duty. The hotel across the street looked the best on the street, so we readily accepted. The rooms turned out to be just OK, and we were expecting similar rooms when we were transferred to the Millennium Suites the next morning. But we were blown away when we saw the rooms at Millennium ! The breakfast spread was outstanding. The staff were so courteous and helpful. There is no elevator in the hotel, but the staff gladly carted our luggage up and down. When I inquired about the best place to change currency, Alper advised me to do it at the Grand Bazar. When I mentioned that I may not be going there for 2 days, he offered to lend me a few hundred Turkish Lire, which I could return whenever I had changed my currency...now that kind of an offer I have never received from any hotel in the world. And the day we went on the afternoon Bosphorus cruise, we ordered some sandwiches to be packed, which we took. When we offered to pay for them, it was waived away as a complimentary offering ! This is what I mean when I say that he runs the hotel with his heart. We were two couples, and we felt quite attached to Alper and his team by the time we left. I don't care if this review sounds like an advertisement.....I have posted far too many reviews on this tripadvisor forum to attract any doubts ! I rarely say this about any hotel, but I will say that this is one of the nicest stays I have ever had anywhere. I have stayed at much fancier places, but this place is real value for money. I don't know if Alper will ever make much money by handing out so much for so little a price, but I certainly wish him all the best !

Reviews.Title: “Nice room, friendly staff, great value!”
Reviews.Author: MrKays
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my girlfriend six nights at the Millennium Suites Hotel in Istanbul. We had a pleasant stay thanks to very friendly stuff and a spacious, clean room in a central, touristy location. The breakfast buffet was good and the wireless internet was complimentary! We paid 100 euros per night which is a great value for this nice place!

Reviews.Title: “wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: mariacarolina0
Reviews.Content: What a fantastic room, much better than the usual rooms in istanbul since we travel at least 3 times to Istanbul each year. The room had 1 large beds, extremely comfortable, lots of pillows and was a full size double bed, again very comfortable - much better than the standard bed style. The room itself was very large and airy, very clean and comfortable. The towels in the bathroom were very large, and the toiletries good quality. We thoroughly enjoyed the buffet breakfast - the variety and quality of the food was excellent. The staff were friendly and polite, and kept the restaurant very clean and tidy, used plates were quickly removed and finished tables cleared immediately. Although we only stayed two nighst I would recommend this hotel, and would have no hesitation in using it again. ....

Reviews.Title: “Mixed results”
Reviews.Author: atw100
Reviews.Content: We had two rooms for four people at the Millennium. One, which was upstairs, was very nice and certainly a good value. (We had relatives staying at the nearby Four Seasons, and our room compared somewhat favorably, especially for the price.) The room at the Milennium was modern and updated, spacious and comfortable. The second room we were given was downstairs and gloomier, on the same level as the restaurant. Unfortunately, the air conditioning for that second room was broken and never fixed during our two-day stay. With the warm weather, this made the room very uncomfortable, and the hotel offered nothing in the way of alternatives or a reduced rate. The rooms came with breakfast, which was quite good. The location is excellent if you are sightseeing in the old city.

Reviews.Title: “"we loved this hotel"”
Reviews.Author: edgar30
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from our 4 night break and cannot find fault with Millenium Suites. The level and quality of service provided by Alper and his team was exceptional! The rooms are spacious and luxurious, as are the en suite rooms. The large TV provided good entertainment in the form of a vast array of channels. We personally did not have any problems with outside noise as the bars and restaurants tended to close before our bedtime, but I can imagine if a guest wants to go to sleep at 9pm this could be a problem. However the beds more than made up for any lost sleep as they were heavenly. In fact, I missed the hotel bed on my first night back home. Alper endeavoured to see to every detail of the trip, which included recommending superb tours and things to do during our visit, unlocking combination locks which had malfunctioned and organising birthday surprises!!! I donâ€™t think there is anything Alper will not do. The breakfast was great and we looked forward to the delicious choices on offer each morning. We didnâ€™t try the hotel restaurant however during the evening it was packed most nights which clearly speaks for itself. The hotel was situated a stoneâ€™s throw from Topkapi Palace, the Blue Mosque, etc so very convenient for tourists. Similarly, there were lots of places to eat out for those looking to relax. The cobbles and ancient architecture certainly gave it the â€˜Old Cityâ€™ feelingâ€¦ We plan to return to Istanbul soon, and when we do Millenium Suites will be our first choice!!! Cannot recommend it highly enough. It definitely surpassed our expectations.

Reviews.Title: “A Jewel In the Sultanmet, Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: tackless3
Reviews.Content: Attentive and helpful multi-lingual staff, exceptionally clean, and very good food. A superb location within easy walking distance of 5 star restaurants and holy sites for both Moslems and Christians. Owners/managers Yelchin and Alper (phonetic) and their staff get our highest rating. We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: edward_johns
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Millennium Suites for 4 nights in a lovely room.The breakfast is always offered with a smile.The manager ,Alper is always take care anything for our comfort.There is nothing he will not do for you.Millennium is a real boutique one if you are looking for this kind of hotel. All people are really friendly and honest and they know all about the city like a guide.Actually the front desk staff are still a student ,studying guidance. The rooms are really clean and large.It is good value for the money we paid.Its location could have been better,all important places ,mosques,museums are nearby.thanks to all

Reviews.Title: “A Splendid Little Hotel in a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: hughstevens
Reviews.Content: My wife and I and another couple stayed at the Millennium Suites for five nights during a recent trip to Turkey. Everything about this friendly little hotel was first rate: the rooms are spacious and comfortable, the bathrooms are well-appointed (the showers are particularly nice), the Turkish breakfast is lavish and varied and the location (easy walking distance to the Hagia Sophia, the Blue Mosque and the Topkapi Palace) is terrific. The very best thing about the hotel, however, is the staff. Everyone went out of his or her way to make sure that we were comfortable, to answer our questions, and to assist us. My wife became ill during our stay as the result of a drug reaction, requiring her to stay in the room and limit her diet to very bland food for the better part of two days. The solicitous and concerned hotel staff went out of their way to provide her with pots of tea and special meals. We have stayed in fancier hotels, but we have never had better service.

Reviews.Title: “Just fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Filip73
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here together with my sister and my parents for 3 nights before getting married in the Four Seasons Sultanahmet. They had arranged a van to pick us up at the airport. The staff at the reception was very friendly and fast - don't be misled by the small reception desk in the back of the restaurant - these guys know how to run their business. During our stay we got personal attention, at the breakfast table or whenever we went out or came back in, we always felt so welcome. The rooms were new and luxurous and very clean with free wifi. When we moved to the Four Seasons they offered to send over our luggage, and later that day they sent flowers to our room in the other hotel! The day after we came back to pick up my sister and my parents to go the airport, and the whole hotel staff was outside to say goodbye. I travel a lot both for pleasure and business staying in hotels in all price ranges; this was definitely one of the best experiences ever and simply the #1 experience if I take the price into account.

Reviews.Title: “The place to stay in the Old city, Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: JQNelson
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Millennium Suites in Istanbul for 4 cold and rainy days this May, but the Hotel Manager, Alper, and his wonderful staff, Taner and Furkan at the front desk, Cem, the waiter, and Arzu, made our stay feel warm, welcoming and comfortable. While you do have to use the stairs, the rooms are clean, the beds large, well appointed and comfortable, and the environment of the wonderful street, lined with open air restaurants and a lovely block from the Blue Mosque, make that unimportant.. Go..you will not be disappointed...

Reviews.Title: “Nice and Clean”
Reviews.Author: FWTravelor
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my stay at the Millenium Suites. The hotel and its rooms are nice and clean. The location is perfect for walking to the major city sites. The staff is very obliging. Yes, they will give you a glass of wine when you arrive. There are convenience marts on either side of the hotel where you can get fruit, chocolate, water and wine. The staff is happy to let you use their wine opener. The breakfasts were excellent and the rooms were very clean. I think it's important to know that there aren't free afternoon drinks and snacks as one might infer from the website (I did). Yes, there is significant street noise. I was on the third floor. Still, I slept through it. The call to prayers throughout the night will be heard. While I very much enjoyed my stay, 112 Euro is very expensive! I'm a Hotwire/Priceline user, and in retrospect, I would've given either a try to reduce the price. I usually stay in European cities using these websites for no more than $120 a night for similar quality. However, it may not have been possible to beat the price for the location. Without advance booking, the other hotels in the area were going for $200 Euro.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: Walker313
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Millennium Suites from April 15-20, 2011. It was a perfect hotel for our visit. First of all, the hotel provided us with private pick-up from the Istanbul Airport and returned us there (without complaint) at 3:00 AM the morning we departed. Secondly, the location of the hotel couldn't have been better. We were close to so many major sites in the old city--the Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia, Topkapi, and more. We walked all over the city--even across the bridge into the neighborhood of the Galata Tower and beyond. We never needed or wanted to take public transportation of any sort except for when we cruised the Bosporus. The hotel was so convenient. Third, our room was spacious, clean, and comfortable. We felt as if we had a private retreat from the bustle of Istanbul when we wanted to rest. Fourth, the food was plentiful and delicious. At any time of day we could eat a meal, have a cup of coffee, a snack or a drink. The hotel was cozy and the endless attention and service were fabulous. Fifth, the staff was delightful and conscientious. We began to feel as if they were good friends before our stay ended. In short, the Millennium Suites was a perfect hotel for our visit. We will return again if we are in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Almost Perfect”
Reviews.Author: grahamstevens
Reviews.Content: Firstly, let me say up front that we really enjoyed our stay at the Millenium Suites and any score below 5 stars would be completely unfair given the quality of our stay. However, it isn't quite perfect. To improve things even further I would suggest: a second chair in rooms, tissues in the bathroom, replacing fruit at breakfast (the same tired looking strawberries were offered each day, bananas and kiwis weren't replaced), checking and replacing in room tea / coffee and toiletries every day. And that is all. Apart from that, everything went so smoothly. The staff are both friendly and helpul (but leave you alone if that is your preference), the rooms are spacious and well equipped, the beds amazingly comfortable, wifi and bottled water are free. There is some street noise from the front bedrooms although this didn't really affect us. Overall a great place to stay and pefect for my No 1 Istanbul tip - go to the Blue Mosque after it officially closes to visitors to see it free of tour groups. We went at 9.30pm and there were about 20 people there. A far more spiritual experience than seeing it earlier in the day.

Reviews.Title: “WONDERFUL HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: Irina111Moscow
Reviews.Content: Everything is wonderful in the hotel. Excellent location, spacious beautiful room (I`m not sure that it`s really 35sqm, but it`s big enough to feel comfortable). The view is the only thing that the hotel doesn`t have. But there are a lot of restaurants near with terraces on the top with incredible views. The staff is very friendly and the atmosphere in the hotel is very enjoyable. Before Millennium Suites I spent 2 nights in 5 star Swissotel the Bosphorus Instanbul, and I wouldn`t say that my stay in Swissotel was better then in Millennium.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!!”
Reviews.Author: nikos80
Reviews.Content: Friendly and polite people, very good prices,very clean and fantastic rooms, too close to Agia Sofia and Blue Mosque ( about 5' on foot ). Thank u Millenium Suites for these great moments in that fantastic location!! our minds are still back there!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “A magical hotel located in the heart of Istanbul!”
Reviews.Author: Farah_Pervez
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from our 4 night break and cannot find fault with Millenium Suites. The level and quality of service provided by Alper and his team was exceptional! The rooms are spacious and luxurious, as are the en suite rooms. The large TV provided good entertainment in the form of a vast array of channels. We personally did not have any problems with outside noise as the bars and restaurants tended to close before our bedtime, but I can imagine if a guest wants to go to sleep at 9pm this could be a problem. However the beds more than made up for any lost sleep as they were heavenly. In fact, I missed the hotel bed on my first night back home. Alper endeavoured to see to every detail of the trip, which included recommending superb tours and things to do during our visit, unlocking combination locks which had malfunctioned and organising birthday surprises!!! I donâ€™t think there is anything Alper will not do. The breakfast was great and we looked forward to the delicious choices on offer each morning. We didnâ€™t try the hotel restaurant however during the evening it was packed most nights which clearly speaks for itself. The hotel was situated a stoneâ€™s throw from Topkapi Palace, the Blue Mosque, etc so very convenient for tourists. Similarly, there were lots of places to eat out for those looking to relax. The cobbles and ancient architecture certainly gave it the â€˜Old Cityâ€™ feelingâ€¦ We plan to return to Istanbul soon, and when we do Millenium Suites will be our first choice!!! Cannot recommend it highly enough. It definitely surpassed our expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderfully friendly, great location, great value, simply great!”
Reviews.Author: holidayfiends
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 days - couldn't have been better looked after! Beautiful, spacious room - lovely shower room - excellent range of goodies! Staff exceptionally helpful and keen to make your stay as enjoyable as possible. Nothing but praise for this unique hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: scde069
Reviews.Content: We spent three nights in two double rooms and had one whole floor for us! The hotel is very clean, the service is great, the people are very nice! The location is very good, there are a lot of nice restaurants and also the most important places of interest are in walking distance. Thank you for all!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: tacostuff
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here in April 2011. Usually, we don't stay at boutique hotels, and opt for hotels like the Four Seasons, Ritz, or Mandarin. This time, we figured we would try this hotel based on the reviews here on Tripadvisor. Overall we were very happy, and we would stay here again. I would not call it "5-star," but it was perfectly nice. Here are some factual observations: 1. When we first checked in, we were given the room on the first floor. I would not recommend this room. It is right off of the restaurant and is basically underground. The view out the window is a cement wall. To their credit, as we were checking in (before we even said anything) they told us we could move to another room the next day when another room opened up. We did this without any problem, and they even moved our bags for us. 2. As a boutique hotel, everything is very personal. Everyone that works there knows when you are coming and going. We usually like the anonymity that you get at a major chain hotel, but it was fine. They were not overbearing, and were actually very friendly. 3. The location is great. 5 minutes to the Blue mosque, 10 minutes to a T1 Tram stop, and the road has lots of restaurants and bars on it. One thing to note, some of the bars are pretty lively (i.e., loud), which didn't bother us (especially since we were creating some of the noise!), but if you are sensitive to this, make sure you get a room that faces the back of the hotel. 4. They advertise the rooms as 35 square meters. I didn't have a tape measure with me, but I don't think the rooms are this big. They are bigger than most European hotel rooms I've stayed in, but probably not 35m2. Overall, not a real problem, because the room was plenty big. 5. One small nit, there are only a couple of outlets. If you are electronic-heavy as we are, bring a splitter to plug all of your stuff in!

Reviews.Title: “I'm not sure it get's better than this!!!”
Reviews.Author: SugaReh
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just stayed in Millennium Suites last week. I cannot say it enough, this is one of the best hotels we have EVER stayed in. We have stayed in all types of hotels all over the world and I think I may have to put this right at the top. First ....the staff, from the moment we walked in the door, exhausted from a traveling, time difference etc. We were immediately taken care of. We arrived very early, way way before check in and they gave us an available room to sleep in until our room was ready....No one does that.....They did! The room was excellent, very very clean and a very nice size...the bed was sooo comfortable!!!!. Decor sexy! Not gaudy! Our room was thoroughly cleaned everyday. Breakfast was excellent (buffet style and omelettes made to order!!!) ...Breakfast was included too...this was Huge!!!! The waitress greeted us every morning with delicious apple tea and a smile. ...Oh and the location.....it gets no better! Walking distance to everything!!! The Bazaar, All the temples and the street the hotel is located on has a bunch of restaurants including the one in the hotel which is EXCELLENT and a bunch of surrounding restaurants that stay open pretty late which was perfect!!! Oh, and little convenient stores at least 3 that were like 3 minutes from the hotel, perfect for late night snacks which me and my husband love!!!! If you come to Istanbul.....You Must stay here.....You will be soooo satisfied and impressed .....over impressed because they make your stay here unforgettable! Oh and the pick up from and to the airport, EXCELLENT! A very clean, large van so you can actually stretch out!!!....so we were impressed before we even got there. I really hope this review is helpful to you. My husband and I never ever leave reviews, BUT, because of the way we felt about this place, we had to. I would recommend this hotel to everyone!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great service, great location, great value!!”
Reviews.Author: jarujaru
Reviews.Content: My partner Don and I stayed for 5 nights at the Millennium Suites in March and had a truly incredible time. The location is amazing- literally 3 minutes from the Blue Mosque, Hagia Sofia, Hippodrome, and all the major sites. The rooms were clean and though it is quite a bustling cobblestone street full of hotels and restaurants we found it very quiet at night and easy to sleep. The service was just amazing throughout. Dealt with the owner/manager Mr Ozturk on email before our stay and he greeted us when we arrived. Throughout our stay though we dealt with the amazing day/evening staff and cannot say enough about them. Furkon & Taner are great guys who switch off running the hotel and were full of great humor, advice and we really enjoyed getting to know them. A new waiter had just started when we arrived, Cem, and he also was just a pleasure to get to know. Arzu(forgive my spelling) set up the breakfast most mornings and made us omelets or cappucinos if we desired and we just loved her as well. When we went to Cappadocia for a few days the hotel was nice enough to hold onto our excess baggage downstairs which made traveling so much easier. I took advantage of the coupon I found on tripadvisor which included one way airport pick up, and a free dinner- as the hotel is still somewhat new they began by opening an all italian menu- the food was very good and Cem treated us very well- I hear though they are looking to expand and include more Turkish fare. The breakfast each morning was very nice and filling with a lot of options. I also appreciated that the staff understood that we were not looking for what the average tourist looks for in a vacation- package tours, dinner 'shows', etc.. and were able to accommodate our specific needs. But I am forgetting to mention the great value of the price- a great deal for the money(especially considering the location, cleanliness, service and the extra airport pick up and meal included) Did a lot of looking and searching for a hotel in Istanbul and though there are certainly fancier and more plush places to choose from I cannot imagine getting a better deal for the money and a better overall experience. We loved the city and getting to know the staff at the Millennium was a highlight of our visit. We will be back again.

Reviews.Title: “Heaven”
Reviews.Author: sacoholly
Reviews.Content: The Millennium Suites in Istanbul, Turkey has been a great experience for me. Upon my arrival the desk clerk Furkan was of great assistance. The rooms are so large and have exceeded my expectations. Everyone at the hotel is very helpful and hospitable, I would have never wished for anything more. The hotel is in a gorgeous street called Akbiyik and is so close to everything from the Ayhagah Sophia Church to the SultanAhmet Mosque probably a two minute walk. Eventhough the weather is a bit called but I feel so warm because of the heart warm welcome of this hotel. The hotel is always clean and I have been here for two days here so far and can truely say that this little gem in Istanbul has been one of the best hotels I have to. It feels like I am in my own neighborhood. I have stayed at many world hotels to include the Four Season, Ritz Cartlon, W, and many others but have never felt so special as I am feeling at this moment. I will keep everyone updated regarding the rest of my trip but so far I give this hotel a 5 starrrrrrrrrr.

Reviews.Title: “great choice for seeing the sites in istanbul”
Reviews.Author: cj_minneapolis
Reviews.Content: Location, location, location! The hotel is just a 2 minute walk to the Blue Mosque, Aya Sofia, Topkapi Palace, and Basilica Cistern. We also walked maybe 15 minutes to the Grand Bazaar, and on another day maybe a 15 minute walk from the port for the cruises on the Bosphorus. Some highlights: 1) staff were really friendly and helpful with everything from luggage to directions to arranging taxis and tours 2) breakfast was great - simple european breakfast, but also included omelettes and turkish coffee and some other turkish treats 3) can't say enough about the location - and on a fairly quiet street compared to other hotels we walked by at night 4) room was new, immaculate, and well appointed. really comfortable bed and linens. 5) cash discount is nice 6) free wi fi 7) free 1-way taxi pickup, which is great - we ended up booking round trip with them a few potential drawbacks depending on how you like to travel: 1) while the street is fairly quiet, we were on the main street side and found it fairly loud even though we were on the 4th floor/top floor. something you may want to inquire about when booking. 2) restaurant is not the best on the street - it's italian food, which not sure why you'd want to eat that in Turkey? 3) we didn't mind a 4 floor walkup, but others may 4) there was not 1 english channel - not even BBC or CNN, which is rare in europe other tips: 1) eat at the meat house around the corner - they have great fresh bread that comes with your meal, and the prices are really reasonable 2) do not book the bosphorus cruises outside of topkapi palace - just go down to the port. we were told we were leaving by 1, and by almost 2 they kept saying they didn't know why the shuttle was not showing up. then took us there by taxi instead of shuttle, but then left us stranded there after the cruise! we ordered 2 cans of beer for the trip, and they charged us 20 turkish lira which is way overpriced. and the boat was small and bumpy - not at all like the photos. it was all quite sketchy. if we did it again, we'd just take the big turyol boats and call it a day.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic; we couldn't have asked for more!”
Reviews.Author: cm2758
Reviews.Content: After looking at a number of hotels, and reading many reviews on Trip Advisor my boyfriend and I decided that we would stay at the Millenium Suites for our short trip to Istanbul, and I am so pleased that we did. I had reasonably high expectations as the reviews I had read had been pretty good, but my expectations were exceeded. The hotel is in an incredible location; literally a couple of minutes walk from the Blue Mosque, Aya Sofia, Topkapi Palace and the Basilica Cistern - you can also very easily walk to the Grand Bazaar and Spice Bazaar from the Hotel. Not only that the room we had was beautiful and the staff made the hotel feel like a home from home - I was sad to leave after our short trip! I had read a few reviews that had said that the breakfast wasn't great; I think that this must have been taken on board as there was a lovely continental style breakfast and we were also offered fresk omlettes, Turkish Tea and Coffee each morning. It was a lovely way to start the day! I am usually quite sceptical about going on organised tours as they can be very expensive - however, I would highly recommend the tours that you can arrange through the hotel, especially boat tours along the Bosphorous and Turkish Entertainment at the Orient House; based on the prices we paid for dinner and entry to sights when we were out and about on our own we thought that they were excellent value for money. All in all, I would highly recommend staying here; the location and quality of the rooms are fantastic, but it is the highly efficient and friendly staff that make this hotel unique and wonderful!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel near the main sites”
Reviews.Author: Eduardo72
Reviews.Content: Nice little hotel with very friendly staff. Rooms are clean and spacious. Beds are very comfortable and we slept well but there is some noise from the street. Breakfast is simple but nice - the cook can rustle up tasty eggs and coffee on reuqest. The hotel is within very easy walking deistance of the majhor sites. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jawadshahin
Reviews.Content: it was a good idea to choose this hotel, first the staff was amazing and helpfull, especially its Manager. The location is very good, close to so many attractions, resturants, bars and cafes serving waterpipe and turkish apple tea. But do not expect huge hotel with spacious lobby or similar, it is a cozy small hotel suites. The hotel is 10 minutes walk from the grand bazzar, tram station, bus station and other shops. the hotel being in Sultanahmet area, provides transportation to and from many touristic places, and can arrage for your tours and cruises. My advise not to go to the fish resturant on the corner at the end of the street right side of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel in very good location”
Reviews.Author: LEuler
Reviews.Content: Hotel is in Sultanahmet District and is 5 minutes walk from the Blue Mosque and Topkapi Palace. The hotel has relatively few rooms but the service of manager Alper and his team is truely exceptional. Rooms are large and our room was very clean. WiFi was free and worked well. We ordered the airport pickup available on the hotel website and it worked very well. We can highly recommend the hotel and would choose it anytime over some standard brand.

Reviews.Title: “What a find!!!”
Reviews.Author: Goodtip
Reviews.Content: An easy walk to ALL the sights!! The staff could not be more helpful!! The area is full of wonderful restaurants...icnluding the best fish restaurant in Istanbul just down the street!!....HIGHLY Recommend!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: Simone79
Reviews.Content: Very beautiful room, spacious and clean. Very nice, welcoming staff that are pleased to give sightseeing advice, even got a surprise dessert delivered in the room. Breakfast with fresh products and very tasty omeletes. Excellent location in small street a short stroll from Blue Mosque and Hagia Sophia on the one and the Palace on the other side. Absolutely recommended.

Reviews.Title: “this is an excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: monaremon
Reviews.Content: we enjoyed our trip to istanbul because we chose this hotel, it made our stay more convenient, the staff was very friendly and willing to help. the hotel is located in a street full of resturants and cafes so it was very easy for us to chose a place to eat or smoke nargila in.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant location; Extremely helpful and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Arun_Ba
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for almost a week while in Istanbul. The location is brilliant - it is a 2 minute walk to Topkapi palace, 5 minutes to the Blue Mosque and the Hagia Sophia. The rooms are clean and big. The best thing about this hotel though was its staff and their hospitality - they really made our stay memorable. We had a complimentary bottle of wine to ourselves - not to mention the endless cups of tea and Turkish coffee. The staff is extremely friendly - ever ready for a chat and even taught us how to make the Turkish coffee!! :) With just 6 days in Istanbul, we had a tough time deciding which places we wanted to visit - the city has so many things to do. Mr. Alper, the manager and Furkan, were always ready to chip in with their suggestions - restaurants, cruises, hamam, shopping etc. We would certainly go back to this hotel on our next visit to Istanbul. It was worth every penny!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience- Incredible Staff”
Reviews.Author: charmich41
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel based on the high reviews on trip advisor, and I am extremely glad I did. This small hotel makes you feel like you are really welcome - nothing is too difficult for the wonderful staff to help you with. Alper and his entire crew of people were all kind, cheerful, and extremely interesting to talk to. We stayed for only 3 nights, but they made us feel right at home. Regarding the rooms, they were wonderful. We had a queen sized bed on the third floor, and there was plenty of room for all of our luggage in addition to space where we could walk around. The bathroom was great, specifically the shower- big and good pressure. The beds were comfty, there was a nice flat screen TV- basically it looks exactly as it does on the website. The only suggestion I would have would be to add a DVD player to the room - the Sattelite TV was lovely but not many channels were in English. The restaurant downstairs was very nicely decorated, and also served as the reception area - it was a little awkword talking to the hotel staff when there were diners inches away having their meals watching you, but not too big of a deal. In terms of the food, I would say it was acceptable- the individual pizzas are a nice touch, and the prices are quite reasonable. It is one of the only Italian restaurants in the area, which I am sure some tourists appreciate, however they could put a bit more effort into their salads. The food in turkey is great (especially the kebabs!), so I would suggest having most of your meals elsewhere. While the breakfast buffet had a nice selection, some more fresh fruit would be great too. One morning we had breakfast delivered to our room- which was lovely- however the food itself was ice cold. If you are staying there, I would highly suggest eating downstairs - and to the hotel, I would suggest making sure the eggs/potatos/hot pastries etc are warmer. In terms of the location of the hotel - it CANNOT be beat. If it is your first time in Istanbul it is a perfect place to stay, as it is walking distance of all the touristic sites, without being in an area that's too loud and busy. Its on a quiet side street which gets lively at night, as there are many restaurants surrounding it. All in all, I really cannot say enough good things about this place - all the things I picked out were little faults, but I know the hotel staff is capable enough to work on them to make it an even greater experience. Alper and staff- thank you so much for a wonderful stay, and we hope to see you all soon in Istanbul!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel with fantastic service and great location!!”
Reviews.Author: Laura085
Reviews.Content: We would like to thank the hotel and the staff for a fantastic stay in Istanbul. From the moment we arrived to the moment we departed we were treat like royalty. The room itself was palatial and extremely clean and we arrived to a complimentary bottle of wine and cheese which was a very nice touch. The staff could not do enough to help you and offered great advice and nothing was too much trouble. We thought the location of the hotel was also superb on a quieter road next to various restaurants and within walking distance to the Blue Mosque etc- we much preferred the Sultanhamet area to other areas in Istanbul. We would without a doubt recommend the hotel to friends and family and once again would like to thank the staff including the lovely lady who served us breakfast for looking after us so well, you have a fantastic hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A true, authentic boutique experience! Unpretentious hospitality.”
Reviews.Author: Shanghai_Rose
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located at the very charming area of Sultanamet. It is within a 5-15mins walk to many attractions, definitely a location you want to be if historic and cultural immersion is the purpose of the trip, Location aside, the hotel itself is another "attraction" for me. I was pleasantly surprised to find out that there are only 7 rooms in the hotel. With only 7 rooms to manage, service is definitely a strong point. In the morning, they tend to have 2-3 service staff to attend to your needs. For a small hotel, the staff will also cook eggs to your order. Turkish tea and coffee are served (willingly and cheerfully) anytime per request. Although there is no elevator in the 4 storey hotel, the staff will deliver all the luggages up to your rooms. This which is a big relief and much appreciated. Last but not least, the staff are just incredible. They are so genuine in serving you and making sure you are well taken care of during your stay. They even kept the buffet open for me when I woke up late for breakfast! On the while, it was a wonderful experience staying with Millenium Suites, a place where I will return to again with my family next time.

Reviews.Title: “excellent service, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: abbasix
Reviews.Content: This place was one of the best places I have stayed in. All the staff, specially the general manager, Mr Alper Ozturk, made our trip to this beautiful destination much more enjoyable. You won't need to ask twice for a service. They were all willing to go the extra mile to make your stay more comfortable. The location is excellent. It's located in a beautiful street close to most of Istanbul great attractions. There are lots of great restaurants within a short walk. If you are a fan of Turkish kebab I would definitely recommend a restaurant called "khorasani". The Millennium Suites is definitely the first one on my list if I decide to visit Istanbul again. I would give the hotel a distinctive 10 out of 10 and would recommend it to anyone planning a visit to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Great room, great location and the best service!!”
Reviews.Author: jennifer091
Reviews.Content: Two friends and I went to Istanbul to explore. This was a great location, close to the tourist highlights of the old city. Everyone at the hotel did their very best to make us comfortable and to facilitate our vacation. Three points so your expectations are relative: there is a smell from the drains sometimes, they know and are working to eliminate. Breakfast is ok and there are stairs not elevators. If you are ok with these minor things then this is the best place in Istanbul. I found the Millenium Suites just perfect.

Reviews.Title: “so romantic”
Reviews.Author: melfituri
Reviews.Content: good hospitality, and great services, all the staff was so kind . we liked the hotel very much and we liked the smile on all the faces of the hotel staff ,

Reviews.Title: “The best choice in Istanbul!!!”
Reviews.Author: leena_jorma
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Istanbul and at the Millenium Suites 4 days one week ago. Both Istanbul and the hotel was more than we ever expected. The best thing at the hotel was warm ann friendly staff and the manager, mr OZTURK was more than helpful. Our room was beutiful and almoust perfect, most of all the kingsize bed was wonderful! We have travelled quite a lot all over the world and stayed at different kind of hotels but the Millenium Suites was one of the best!

Reviews.Title: “OUSTANDING VALUE”
Reviews.Author: CEM69
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Millennium Suites for 2 days before month-long trip to Thailand, and we are staying there again at end of vacation. Location is PERFECT. Service is EXCELLENT. Staff extremely friendly. Charming small boutique hotel with good value for money. Can't say enough good things about this hotel. Our new "home" when in Istanbul. Jason and Birsen Cappello

Reviews.Title: “Very stylish, luxury accommodation, very well situated”
Reviews.Author: Marcelle312578
Reviews.Content: We had amazing service. The manager and staff were very helpful and accommodating to all our needs.'The rooms are large with extra king beds, wonderful linen and pillows and a separate shower . it was very well situated, right within walking distance to all the major sites. I really liked the way the rooms were decorated.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place for romantic getaway.”
Reviews.Author: Katya1234
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed for six nights in this amazing boutique hotel. Very nice neighbourhood with spectacular sights in the walking distance. Rooms are very spacy with nice interior and big plasma :-) Staff is extremely friendly and helpful. They treat each and every customer with care and attention. Breakfast is also very good and can be served right in your room. Apart from that there are plenty of restaurants near by. To sum up, it is a wonderful place an we definetly come back there again!

Reviews.Title: “best view of istanbul”
Reviews.Author: andyDoha
Reviews.Content: I was in Istanbul 2 months ago for 5 days. It was unplanned trip and I am recommended by my friends to stay in Millennium Suites Hotel. Me and my family had wonderful days. In a hotel, rooms are very big and comfortable. Hotel is located center of Istanbul, near Blue Mosque. It is big advantage for transportation, very close to rail way and port. Also hotel management and the stuff are very kind, helpfull and friendly. They bring us from airport when we arrived istanbul. definitely i will stay there again my next trip.

Reviews.Title: “One of my favorite hotels!”
Reviews.Author: Ermie0812
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Millennium Suites on a 1 month summer vacation throughout Europe. My husband is a Platinum Member at the Marriott's and a Diamond Member at the Hilton. We were not quite sure about staying in a relatively â€˜unknownâ€™ hotel. However, this hotel blew pass our expectations. What an incredible experience. Great location! Literally, just a few minutes from the Hagia Sophia and the incredible nightlife of Istanbul. Iâ€™m glad we stayed there. The owner operator is great and the staff very friendly. The rooms are nicely decorated and had a great ambiance overall. We plan to travel to Istanbul again and we will definitely stay here.

Reviews.Title: “The stay was a very excellent,the staff & service were also excellent”
Reviews.Author: MrFunnylooking
Reviews.Content: Our stay started with the driver meeting us at the airport & taking our luggage to the van.We were then driven to the Millennium Suites & greeted by Mr.Ozturk.He & his staff were very friendly & courteous.The rooms were very clean and spacious.They even emptied out the mini bar for us so we could put our own items from the grocery store in the mini bar.Mr.Ozturk was more than helpful with all of our request.I would highly recommend staying atThe Millennium Suites to anyone that visits Istanbul,Turkey.It was my & my lady friends first visit to Istanbul & we stayed for 5 days there in Istanbul.It was just a great experince.One you must experince for yourself. We would stay at The Millennium Suites again if when we visit Istanbul,Turkey again.Written by Ed.Reich

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel - amazing service, great location”
Reviews.Author: JaneHanim
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 4 nights in January 2011 and would thoroughly recommend staying here. The hotel is in an excellent location (and is just around the corner from the Four Seasons) and the service is amazing. I booked directly with the hotel - taking advantage of their special offers (which included breakfast and pick up at the airport). Hotel: The hotel has just 7 rooms and has been renovated to a very high standard (the rooms really are as shown on the hotel's website). The front desk is to one side of the restaurant and there's always someone available to help. Breakfast is buffet style - there's a great selection and they're also happy to make you an omelette if you'd like. And lunch and dinner (or just drinks) are available during the day. The room is comfortable (as are the beds) - and the shower is excellent. Bathrobes and slippers are also provided and there's a safe in the room. And a flat screen TV with lots of channels for when you're worn out with sightseeing and just need to crash for a bit (they also provide orange cupcakes and other sweets with the tea and coffee in the room, and there's bottled water etc. in the fridge). Service: Absolutely amazing service. I've stayed in many hotels over the years and can honestly say that the service from Alper and all of his team is the best I've ever experienced. I felt like one of the family. Everyone was very helpful and nothing was too much trouble - they happily arranged a half day cruise of the Bosphorus for me so that I got to see more of the Golden Horn and the Maiden's Tower. There was always a hot drink or snack when I came in from the cold; when my iPod was running out of power they charged it up for me. In the evenings, I could sit around drinking beers, reading or just chatting with Alper (the owner, who speaks very good English) and Mehmet (the barman, who speaks very good French and some English) - and learning more about Turkey and her people. I arrived a stranger, and left feeling like one of the family. Location: The hotel is in the old part of the city (Sultanahmet) and it's a five minute walk to the Aya Sofya, Blue Mosque, Topkapi Palace and the Archaeology Museums. There are lots of restaurants in the area and numerous shops and bazaar's (and ATMs). Most of the time I used Turkish Lira though I found that euro's were accepted at a number of the sites as well (and the ATMs could give out both). There's so much to see and do that it's hard to decide - I would definitely recommend all the above, though it was the Archaeology Museums that I returned to for a second day. I wouldn't wanted to have missed the Basilica Cisterns either. Nor the Bosphorus cruise. Basically, 4 days wasn't really long enough and I ended up spending most of my time in the Sultanahmet and Bazaar areas as I didn't want to end up rushing all over the city (and it's a very big city). And this is where the location of the hotel is great - everything is so close to the hotel that it's easy to pop back and rest for a bit, or grab something that you've forgotten. Travelling Solo: Travelling on my own I wasn't sure how safe I would feel in Istanbul. The answer is very safe - having a great hotel as a base really helped, as did the advice of one of Alper's friends (Aslan). I had asked how to make the people who came up to me offering guided tours etc. go away (as "please go away" wasn't working great and I didn't want to be rude) and he told me to ignore anyone who approached me when I was out sightseeing (very good advice, and I noticed that the local women also took this approach and just sailed past them like they weren't there). The street where the hotel is located always had people around and, overall, I found the Turkish people that I spoke with very friendly and helpful. Books to read: In addition to the guidebooks, any of Barbara Nadel's (I read Harem ) or Clive and Dirk Cussler's Crescent Dawn. All set in Istanbul and capturing something of the city. Finally, my thanks to Alper Bey and all of his team. Thank you for making my vacation wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Choice!!!”
Reviews.Author: oakie13
Reviews.Content: The best choice if you want to stay close to the most importants places. Everything was perfect!!!

Reviews.Title: “Five-star position, five-star service”
Reviews.Author: Runeberg
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Millenium Suites over Christmas. Position, position, position as the estate agents say. Not more than 5 min walk to Topkapi, the Blue Mosque or Haghia Sofia. 10 min to the market. Service: Alper Ozturk and his team couldnÂ´t have been more helpful - no need to say more! Room: spacious, comfortable, clean. The bedside lamps were not really for reading (though the bulbs were immediately changed for stronger ones. We were first shown a room at the back but found it too dark. The front room are on a fairly busy street, but it didn't bother us. The noise from the slightly loose hotel sign did, but that will now have been seen to. No lift so older people should make sure to get a room on the first floor. The bathroom new. I would have liked to have an anti-slip mat in the bath as it was quite slippery. I didnÂ´t ask for it though. Alper, will you make a note of that? I was told that in the US someone fell in the bath and was seriously injured. It cost the hotel $50,000 ... Don't chose this hotel if you want a view of the Bosphorus as there is no view of it. Alper showed us plans of the renovation of the lounge/ reception area to be done in February 2011. All in all, almost 100% perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Extreme comfort, New friends”
Reviews.Author: arrieq123
Reviews.Content: I travelled with my brother and his girlfriend to Istanbul and Cairo at the end of January. We stayed 4 nights in the Millennium Suites hotel and had a wonderful time. The hotel is small and intimate. We were able to get to know the workers at the hotel who took great care of us! They provided us with lots of ideas on what to do during our days in Istanbul. I think the best part of the small setting was that the hotel employees were kind enough to hang out late at night with us in the small Italian restaurant on the bottom floor of the hotel (that, by the way, has some great pizza!). It was great to be able to hang out, drink endless tea and wine, and talk with them! The rooms in the hotel are beautiful and immaculately clean. The beds were extremely comfortable. We were actually sad to leave Istanbul when we headed to Cairo!

Reviews.Title: “A very enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: rwjc
Reviews.Content: Although getting to Istanbul from London during xmas 2010 was a night mare [ but not as bad as some I'm sure ] and we were delayed our driver was still at the airport despite a 4 hr wait, thats when our holiday picked up. The hotel was well positioned just at the back of the blue mosque and within walking distance to the grand bazaar, with restaurants located all around it. The staff were great, very helpful and even helped us out when my better half needed a dentist in a hurry, within 1hr, less 1 tooth and a cost of 50GBP we couldnt complain. They organised day trips and our transfers to and from the airport. We couldnt recommend this hotel enough it was great.

Reviews.Title: “Great Room, Great Service But Terrible Street and Too Expensive”
Reviews.Author: TheVastMachine
Reviews.Content: As other reviewers have pointed out, the rooms are large and well-appointed, the beds are comfortable and the service is great. But despite all the other gushing reviews, you need to keep in mind that this hotel is on an incredibly tacky street, there is no lobby - it's a pizza parlor, pure and simple - and the neighborhood can be very noisy until midnight. (There was a guy playing the sax nonstop from 7PM - 12AM at a restaurant two doors down every night we were there.) The windows are not double glazed, and it takes a little bit of effort to arrange all the curtains to insure the street light doesn't get in to the room. And given the rates of other hotels in the neighborhood, no way is it worth the almost EUR250 per night we paid. If you can get this hotel for around EUR110 and are not bothered by noise / light, absolutely go for it.

Reviews.Title: “Really excellent hotel with outstanding service”
Reviews.Author: DMEtraveller
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from spending 4 nights over Christmas at Millenium Suites. From the moment we arrived to the moment we left we received outstanding service from the management and staff. My mother stayed in the ground floor room and I was on the 4th floor. Rooms were spacious, clean and comfortable. My room overlooked the back of the hotel and there was no noise at all from outside. Bed was large and very comfortable. Room had free wifi and a big LCD TV, with a few English channels such as BBC world. Nothing was too much for the staff. When we returned from sightseeing the first day of our stay, we asked for some tea and baklava. They didn't have any baklava, so the manager sent one of the team to the shops to buy some - and then refused to let us pay for it. It's a small hotel, on a street with other hotels and restaurants near to the Blue Mosque. If you are looking for a good value hotel to stay for a few days in Sultanahmet you really can't beat the Millenium Suites.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel. Will definitely stay there the next time I'm in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Single_Black_Female
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel based on reviews on Trip Advisor and I am so happy I choose this place. I traveled to Turkey by myself for a nice relaxing vacation and stayed at this hotel for a total of about 8 days while I was in Istanbul ( I traveled to a few other cities in Turkey during the middle of my two week vacation there.) If you like small boutique hotels (only has 7 rooms) at a great value then this is the place for you. Why I loved this place: 1) The staff: Everyone from the owner to the guys working the front desk and the cook were extremely friendly and kind to me while I was there. In particular, Erhan, who works at the front desk went above and beyond taking me and and two other guests at the hotel site-seeing around Istanbul or shopping on his off time. He didn't ask or request payment for his time. Over the entire stay I found him to be very helpful and fun to talk to. Even the owner was extremely friendly and once he invited me to have lunch with him and the staff one afternoon when I got back early from site-seeing. **two stay fair and balanced, I will say that like all hotels if you ask them their opinion on site-seeing options they will promote tours offered by certain companies for which I am sure they get a commission. But as all hotels I've ever been too do this, this didn't bother me. 2) The rooms: The rooms are surprisingly large, clean and attractive. It appears as if the rooms have been recently renovated. I stayed in two of the rooms while I was there. They both had King size beds that were very comfortable. The rooms have all the basic amenities and they even provide you slippers to wear in your room. The first room I stayed in was on the first floor. The room is located behind the restaurant/lobby area. You pass through two doors to enter the room as a means of soundproofing. I will warn you that if you stay in that room, you definitely have to have the outer door closed or you will hear everything that is being said in the lobby. Also, the room is a little darker than the others because the window faces a wall that I think they stated is one of the old fortress walls that used to protect that part of Istanbul. The second room I stayed in, Rm. 201, is a great room in the back part of the hotel that has a large private terrace outside the room. I didn't really get to enjoy the terrace since it was a little cold to be sitting outside but I can see that it would be very enjoyable in the summer time. Be warned though that by private terrace I mean that it can only be accessed by 201 BUT the terrace faces the back end of apartments in the area so its not like you would go out there in your underwear or anything unless you want to give your neighbors a view....That being said, I have decided that that is the room for me if I go back. **additional disclaimer, when taking a shower in the bathroom it is best to use the shower-head as a handheld device. If you mount it on the wall to use it stationery, you will get water all over the bathroom floor because the shower doesn't have a door, just a piece of glass that only extends just under half-way across the length of the shower. **also, for those traveling in large groups, you should know that the hotel owns a large 3 bed room apartment on the next street over from the hotel which currently rents for 100 Euros a night. The flat was very secure with the top and bottom lock having 3 turns each to lock and there is a safe in each bedroom (the main hotel has safes in the room as well). Each bedroom has a king size bed so it easily sleeps 6 people comfortably. I had to stay in the flat the first night of my trip because the hotel was full. The flat was obviously recently renovated and was very attractive but at the time the kitchen was missing a microwave and there were no waste paper baskets. I pointed this out to the owner and I'm sure that has since been rectified. Lastly, because it is not located on the main property, it seemed that housekeeping has to be reminded to go there to clean (which I guess is okay if the point of a flat is to have more privacy). If I was traveling in a group, the flat would have been a great option. 3) The location: The hotel is located in the Sultanhamet district which is where many of the major culture sites are located such as the Blue Mosque and Haga Sofia. It is about a 5 minute walk to the tram stop and a nice relaxing walk (about 15 minutes) to the Bosphorus river.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant hotel, outstanding service!”
Reviews.Author: Joey55
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Millenium Suites for 8 nights in November 2010 after travelling through Europe on a 24 day Trafalgar Tour. Needless to say, we were exhausted when we arrived in Istanbul, and due to the fact that we had been travelling to so many countries before Turkey, I had not called the hotel beforehand to confirm that our transfer but we had arrived at the airport and our transfer was hassle free. We arrived at the hotel and were greeted by the hotel owner Alper and other staff and we were given a complimentary welcome drink and our bags were taken to our rooms, which were extremely clean, and the furnishings looked brand new. The rooms were also very large and the much anticipated beds had definitely met my expectations. The location of the hotel is extemely central, and two minutes from the blue mosque and hagia sofia which was fantastic, and the hotel also has an in house italian restaurant which has excellent food. The service I recieved at this hotel was second to none in Europe. Both myself and my wife were amazed at the hospitality of ALL the staff. We felt as though we were at home. Nothing was too much trouble for the staff at the hotel, even the housekeeping staff always had a smile on their faces and no request made to them was too much to ask. I am generally a very fussy person and I am very critical when I go to hotels, but I cannot find a fault with this hotel, I was very impressed and they had definitely EXCEEDED my expectations, and I will, without ANY hesitation recommend this hotel to anyone going to visit istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “so clean rooms and phenomenally comfortable large bed in a large well decorated room!!!”
Reviews.Author: Anya_Surovceva
Reviews.Content: This beautifull hotel is centrally located in a nice street that is full of nice restaurants,bars ,hotels and nice people from all over the world.This street and of course our hotel were like a meeting point where people come together from all over the world and close to the Blue mosque ,Agia Sophia,Topkapi palaces and less than 10 minutes to the Grand Bazaar by foot.I advise you to use TL as you are in Ä±stanbul and should do exchange in the grand bazaar too.Do make in at the airport and any other place.They pay too less for your money. The hotel has really large absolutely quite,so clean and very well decorated rooms and batrooms. There were anything in the room that you might need during your stay ( a smart kettle,any kind of teas , jacops and ironing board, toothbrush and shaving kits, wet napkinetc.) I have to underline that the bed was a queen size and absolutely the most comfortable one I have ever seen,even more than my bed at home. The staff is so friendly and helpfull and made our trip so enjoyable and economical by recommendations and special discounts.I can not thank you enough for their warm hospitality.We got the service to the airport for return with a reasonable price . It was really cheaper than taxi we got from the airport to the hotel.Advise you to get this service especially for the trip from airport to the hotel.We paid to much to the taxi driver who never knows the town and could not find the hotel ,get around and around to find .

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, modern, convenient, great value”
Reviews.Author: jczepiel
Reviews.Content: The staff was welcoming, the room large and the bathroom very modern and done in marble. The location was but a less than 5 minute walk to the major sites. The street scene lively with many sidewalk cafes. We've already recommended it to friends

Reviews.Title: “What a wonderful surprise”
Reviews.Author: Akka33
Reviews.Content: The hotel with which we originally booked was being renovated so we were "forwarded" to Millennium Suites. What a gem. Recently renovated, the bedroom and bathroom were large, very comfortable and beautifully decorated. We particularly liked the up-to-date energy saving touches. The staff was excellent, charming and always ready to help. Breakfast delicious. An added bonus was being five minutes walking distance from the Blue Mosque area and 15 minutes from the Grand Bazaar. The hotel has a restaurant and if you wanted to try something else, the little cobbled street had a wide range to choose from. We loved it and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Home Away Home”
Reviews.Author: Gsad
Reviews.Content: Thank you Tripadvisor, for helping me finding this lovely hotel and to plan a super 8 day holiday in Istanbul. Me, my wife and two kids spent all 8 days at an apartment (3-rooms, 1 bathroom a kitchen and living room) belongs to the Millennium Suites, which is less than a minute walk from the main hotel. The large, clean and comfortable rooms for the price I paid never prompted me to look for alternate hotels. All rooms are equipped with satellite TV, heaters and safety lockers. The kitchen too was equipped with a stove, dishwasher and fridge although we never used them. The manager Alper and his staff are so friendly and caring. The hotel is in a great location. It was walking distance to the most famous attractions like Topkapi, Sophia Hagia, and the Blue Mosque. The closest tram station (Sultanahmet) is just 5 minutes away. There are an ample choice of restaurants and some lovely gift shops around the hotel. The hotel can help you with some useful advice on where to go in Istanbul and arrange some tours with great discounts. Many thanks for Alper and his staff, and definitely looking forward to visit this lovely city.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value and Great Location”
Reviews.Author: adl1486
Reviews.Content: The Millennium has a great location, helpful staff and clean rooms. The past reviews of the Millennium have been so great that we were disappointed. There are only 7 rooms in this boutique hotel. There are two rooms on each of the second, third and fourth floors, There is no elevator. You enter through a simple italian restaurant and the hotel counter is to the right within the restaurant. One of the 7 rooms is off of the lobby and the restaurant. We were in this room the initial night. I would recommend when making reservatons that you ask not to be in the ground floor room. The italian restaurant is very simple and the food is good especially if you are exhausted after a day of sightseeing and walking - salads, pezzas and pastas. The staff very helpful and responsive to our needs. We plan on returning to Istanbul and will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Quality rooms,great location very friendly & helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: redandwhitearmy
Reviews.Content: Booked the Millenium after reading reviews on Trip Advisor and it didn't disappoint us. Quality rooms (we stayed in 301 but presume they have all been done to the same standard) and a friendly, helpful team of staff especially Erhan and the tireless Arzu. Great location for the better known sights and close to the tram if you want to explore more of the city and waterfront. Recommend you visit the mosque, palace and bazar as early in the morning as you can - obviously they do get very busy!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: Sweeps1970
Reviews.Content: After a long and tiring train trip to Istanbul, we arrived at Millennium Suites. We couldn't have been happier with our reception - the staff were extremely welcoming and helpful, and even let us check into our room even though it was early in the day. The room itself was amazing - huge bed, roomy bathroom and all the facilities you could want, including WiFi. It was also spotlessly clean. During our stay we found every staff member went out of their way to assist us with anything we needed. Breakfast was also great! This hotel is within walking distance of all the major sites plus has good access to transport. Overall, I couldn't reccomend this place highly enough - it was an oasis in the heart of Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel of sultanahmet and istanbul”
Reviews.Author: emreunlu
Reviews.Content: i m from istanbul but i live in canada...i'm always on business travel so i come to turkey everymonth...i discover millenium suites newly.... the best boutique hotel i have ever seen...foods are delicious..rooms are wonderful..great staff, heartfelt and hospitable...thanks to alper and his staff..millenium suites hotel is my new home in turkey ....

Reviews.Title: “Perfect safe hub for Istanbul visit”
Reviews.Author: Humblecanadian
Reviews.Content: We stayed several days after a cruise. What counts for us when renting a hotel room? It must be clean,safe,central,quiet,with help in dealing with travel and other arrangements and good value for the price. On this basis Millenium suites scores a ten. The rooms are new, totally clean,bright and. Big...and ours was very quiet at night even though the hotel is located on an active smaller street with lots of good restaurants. Location in the old city of Sultanahmet is ideal for access to major tourist targets Our hosts very patiently advised us on where to go, what to avoid,etc. We,d go there again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Was expecting a more luxurious hotel. That said, location is perfect.”
Reviews.Author: SGmember
Reviews.Content: There is a reason the website only shows the rooms...that's because there is practically no lobby to this hotel. We thought our airport transfer had made a mistake with the address. Why were they dropping us off at a restaurant? The check in is at a little counter at the back of the (Italian) restaurant and we felt quite awkward standing there with all our luggage amidst the diners. Given the price we were paying and their claim to be a luxury boutique hotel, that did not give the impression of being either. I must say I felt rather let-down. Nonetheless, the room was spacious, comfortable and well-provided (though our TV had no volume and the guy who was trying to show us how it works didn't make an effort to ensure that it worked before he passed the control back to us and left the room). The shower cubicle also leaked, flooding our bathmat which was rather unpleasant. They did give us a complimentary bottle of wine to welcome us though. Breakfast was a small spread, not fantastic, just sufficient. We thought it was strange that when we went for breakfast our 2nd morning, there were 2 guys there (who turned out to work there) who didn't bother turning the lights on for us in the dining room till they had finished with their smoke outside. That said, the location of the hotel was perfect. Given that we had only 1 day to explore, the proximity to the sights was extremely convenient as we did not have to waste travel time. The street on which the hotel is on is a nice one, filled with eateries and hotels - but is extremely touristy (with prices to match). I think I would have given a better rating if (i) we had been paying a more reasonable rate for the room - I just did not feel it was worth the price, especially with the sort of breakfast offered; and (ii) the website had given a more accurate impression of the sort of hotel it was. I have no complaints about the room itself (apart from the leaky bathroom cubicle which hopefully has since been fixed) - the bed was extremely comfortable and the room spacious, but I was expecting a more luxurious hotel for the price (which was equivalent to a 5-star one we had stayed in in Spain), and based on the impression given by the hotel's website. Oh yes, if you require airport transfer, I'd recommend you arrange your own. The hotel wanted to charge me 35 Euros one way, and I only paid 20 Euros for mine.

Reviews.Title: “Close to everything”
Reviews.Author: waynekeady
Reviews.Content: Big rooms, huge comfortable beds and great staff. Thanks to Alper and his staff.

Reviews.Title: “Millenium suites felt like home”
Reviews.Author: Reenanaiah
Reviews.Content: This was my first visit to Istanbul and I must say I am glad I chose to stay at millenium suites. The hotel location is amazing, walking distance to all the major sights and the grand bazaar. The rooms are very good, clean and spacious. For me Alper who runs the hotel made all the difference. He was most helpful arranging cruise tickets, helped us with sight seeing, even organized a cake for my birthday ... Amazing. I loved my stay there , we came in as guests and left as friends.

Reviews.Title: “Service with a Smile”
Reviews.Author: spaceman000
Reviews.Content: If the greatest asset of any hotel is the management, then without a doubt Alper Ozturk is the spirit of Millenium Suites. Our interaction with him started way before we landed, and Millenium Suites not only gave us exemplary service, but even during the days the room was unavailable, the hotel (and Alper) took care to ensure our stay was equally comfortable in another hotel. That was service beyond the call of duty. The room was large and overlooked a back garden space which remained regretfully unutilised simply because the hotels magnificent location ensured our absence from the room for the most part of our vacation. Its minutes away by foot from some of the most historical sites in old Istanbul.. Sultanahmet has such amazing attractions as the Blue Mosque, Aya Sofya, Topkapi Palace and the Square, and the Grand Bazaar just around various corners from the hotel and we didnt spend a minute in any taxi except to and from the airport. In keeping with all other hotels in the vicinity, the temperature control was geared towards heating rather than air conditioning this time of year, but even that was amended to suit our preference of cold rather than hot. The bathrooms were very clean, rooms were large and comfortable... and the television was adequate. Every need was personally taken care of, and two days after we returned home, the hotel (Alper again) communicated that we had left behind an I pod and that he would post it to any address we cared to choose. How could we give this hotel anything less than five stars after that effort?

Reviews.Title: “Just like being with a family”
Reviews.Author: Celtic21
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is excellent -all the staff are very friendly and they go out of their way to make you "feel at home" . There is a good selection for breakfast and the beds are very comfortable and the rooms both clean and well provided. We will certainly recommend the Millenium Suites to our friends and when we next return to Istanbul we will be staying there again Well done all we had a great time.

Reviews.Title: “Your expectations will be exceeded at this fine Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Rig11
Reviews.Content: I have been to Istanbul a numerous times but i must admit this is the best hotel i have stayed in. This was my second stay at this hotel and i was not disappointed. The hotel is a few minutes walk to the Blue Mosque and all the attractions. It has charm and the management and staff will go out of their way to exceed your expectations and cater to all your needs.
